boardgame.name: Marooned in Space
boardgame.description:
User Summary

A simple educational program with a space adventure theme.

Your spaceship is marooned in orbit around one of the planets or planetoids of our solar system. Can you analyze the scanner data and correctly identify the unknown planet? You have seven chances to identify where you are located before the computer manages to figure it out and charts a course back to Earth.

boardgame.name: Lipogram
boardgame.description:
Lipogram is a party game where you make your team guess words but without using specific letters.
It can be both a cooperative game, where you must face challenges, or a competitive one, where you must make your team guess the word fast enough, based on a "tug of war" system.

The game requires a free mobile application.

listing.notes:
Game is as new.
FREE SHIPPING TO EUROPE AND NORTH AMERICA !!!
Any boardgames order from this list starting from: $250 and above (EU zone) $360 and above (rest of Europe) $500 and above (USA and Canada) will ship FOR FREE, including sturdy package and tracking number !!! Any other destination country will also get very special shipping prices, almost free, ask for details !!

boardgame.name: Robots: Juego de Asociación
boardgame.description:
Robots is a matching card game that invites you to observe, compare and focus your attention.

Goal of the game:
Be the first to get rid of all the cards in your hand. Each player will be able to get rid of their cards every time they find matches in eyes, mouth or nose with the card that is face up on the table.

To play between 2 or more, from the age of 5.

boardgame.name: The Game of the Three Soldiers
Jeu des trois soldats
Spiel von drei Soldaten
boardgame.description:
Both players have three soldiers; one player plays with black, the other with yellow. One of the players puts his soldiers upon the 3 blue spaces marked 1, the other puts them upon those marked 2. Each player alternately advances a soldier following the black lines in any direction, one space at a time.

In order to win it is necessary to advance so far as to be able to place your 3 soldiers on 3 spaces of the same color (blue or green) in such a manner that a triangle with specific properties is formed.

—user summary

boardgame.name: Stega och dippa
boardgame.description:
A simple roll and move game with dinosaurs that accompanies the comic book "Kalle Anka & C: O" no. 42, October 18, 1993 (Kalle Anka is the Swedish name for Donald Duck). Roll the dice and move your game piece, read what is in the square. First in goal wins.

—user summary

boardgame.name: Äggjakten
boardgame.description:
A simple roll and move game included in the comic book "Kalle Anka & C:O" no. 13/14, March 28, 1994 (Kalle Anka is the Swedish name for Donald Duck). Roll the dice and move your game piece and read what is in the square. The goal is to collect the most Easter eggs before the finish line. The one with most eggs when everyone has reached the finish line wins.

—user summary

boardgame.name: Disney's Pocahontas spel
boardgame.description:
A simple roll and move game with Disney´s Pocahontas as the theme (included in the comic book "Kalle Anka & C: O" no. 49, December 4, 1995). Kalle Anka is the Swedish name for Donald Duck. Roll the dice and move your game piece to the finish line.

—user summary

boardgame.name: Connectors: Mission Space
boardgame.description:
In Skillmantics Connectors Mission space 1-4 players aim to build a rocket trail and defeat aliens. Game can be played contributing to one main map or with each player trying to expand their own spaceship trails as much as possible.
Group layout.

Distribute 3 tiles to player
Place starting tile. Tiles need to be placed connecting similar colors and asteroids may not be aimed towards planets. Aliens must not face each other.
Players pick any tile from their hand to add to start. If they cannot they draw from the tile bank.
First player to use all their tiles wins.

boardgame.name: Ratz Fatz Ich und Du
boardgame.description:
This game consists of a serious of 4 educational games where children learn more about themselves and their friends.

1. Ordering
This is a cooperative ordering game where all cards are put face up on the table. An adult asks the children to find all cards belinging to one category (eg. all cards with something eatable)

2. Sorting
This is a cooperative game where all children try to categorize cards one by one.

3. Taking
All cards are put face up on the table. An adult reads a story. As soon as one of the pieces on the cards is mentioned in the story, the kids should take the corresponding card. The fastest kid with the most cards wins.

4. Remembering
7 cards are put face up on the table. The remaining ones are put in the box. An adult reads a story. As soon as one of the pieces on the cards which are in the box is mentioned in the story, the kid shouts out. If it's correct and the card is in the box, the child gets one of the cards on the table. If it's wrong and the piece is on the table, the child has to put one of his cards back on the table.
The kid with the best memory and therefore the most cards wins.

boardgame.name: Zauberbaum
boardgame.description:
The game contains 3 games about the magic tree, its fruit, a caterpillar, a blackbird and a cat.

1. Classifying
This is a cooperative game where the wooden fruit and the animals should be classified and inserted into the game board.

2. Simple Dice Game
The children are taking turns in rolling the dice. When the dice shows one of the fruits on the tree, the child gets this fruit. When all fruits are taken from the magic tree, the child with the most fruits wins.

3. Searching
All puzzle pieces are put face down on the table. The children are taking turns in revealing the pieces. The kid who is the first one in recognizing any differences to the board game and finds the correct place, gets this piece. The child with the most pieces wins.

boardgame.name: Först i boet!
boardgame.description:
A simple game with Disney's squirrels Chip ´n´ Dale where the first in the squirrels nest wins. But you have to get the number in the next square with the dice to move to that square.

The game is included in the comic book "Musse Pigg & C:o", No. 9, September 1983 (Musse Pigg is the swedish name for Mickey Mouse).

boardgame.name: The Elder Scrolls: Call to Arms – Into the Dark
boardgame.description:
The ancient Tombs and Darkened Caves of Skyrim are home to many treasures - and many dangers. Dare you venture into the dark to claim them? Take on the foes and threats that the world of The Elder Scrolls throws at you, where ancient enemies and fierce creatures the outcome is all up to you.

Into The Dark provides the core rules for random dungeon generation, and includes modules for Nordic Tombs and Wilderness Caves. Future releases will feature additional settings, such as Bandit Camps and Dwemer Ruins.

17-page random delve designer system to allow you to procedurally generate multi-level dungeons.
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: The Elder Scrolls: Call to Arms

boardgame.name: Schere Stein Papier
boardgame.description:
The game is based on the classic game of chance (scissors, stone, paper): Scissor beats paper. Paper beats stone. Stone beats scissor.
Every player selects one of the symbols on his board. When all players are done, the privacy shields are removed. All players calculate their scores and the next turn starts. As soon as one player scores 10 points, he wins.

—user summary

boardgame.name: Sandmännchens Gute Nacht Spiel
boardgame.description:
This is a short game before going to bed.
The starting player rolls the dice and moves the sandman accordingly and puts a star on all the fields he passes by. Now it's the next player's turn who rolls the dice again and puts stars on the board.
When all stars are on the board, the next round begins: The starting player rolls the dice again, but this time he turns all the stars face down. When all stars are face down, the job of the sandman is done and the kids can go to sleep.
The kid, whose stars are the last face up, wins.

—user summary

boardgame.name: Stop & Shop
boardgame.description:
Stop & Shop is a shopping game.
The player puts one of his dice tokens face down and moves his meeple. If the meeple is in front of a shop, he can go into the shop and buy as much as he can. He can put all the stuff he bought on his shopping card. As soon as he has fulfilled all the requested items on the shopping card, he can turn the shopping card face down and put the goods back in the supply. The player who is th first one to finish his shopping cards wins.

—user summary

boardgame.name: Timeline: Polska – Kaszuby
boardgame.description:
A unique set of 10 additional cards that will expand your set of Timeline: Poland cards with events related to the history of Kashubia. Prepared in two languages ​​(on the one hand, the event cards are described in Polish, on the other - in Kashubian) and decorated with unique graphics, they are an interesting variety and allow us to expand our knowledge even more.

The set was created in cooperation with the Kashubian-Pomeranian Association.


Wyjątkowy zestaw 10 kart dodatkowych, które rozszerzą Twój zestaw kart do gry Timeline: Polska o wydarzenia związane z historią Kaszub. Przygotowane w dwóch językach (z jednej strony karty wydarzenie opisane jest po polsku, z drugiej - po kaszubsku) i ozdobione unikalnymi grafikami stanowią ciekawe urozmaicenie i pozwalają jeszcze bardziej poszerzyć naszą wiedzę.Zestaw powstał we współpracy ze Zrzeszeniem Kaszubsko-Pomorskim.

boardgame.name: Flower Battle
boardgame.description:
A game based on the traditional Korean card game Go Stop, with some differences. The game uses a modernized, more colorful Hanafuda deck. Flower Battle differs from Go Stop in the following ways:
1. Although 4 players may begin, only 3 players may play the main game; there is a pre-round elimination procedure in which player who "dies" may sell his/her Gold cards (called Bright cards in Go Stop) for points.
2. Go Stop decks have 4 or 5 joker/wild cards; Flower Battle has 3 wild cards that are doublers and a blank card for you to customize.
3. Flower Battle has options for scoring such as Wild Boar Hunt (players put their scoring sticks in a box; the player with the boar card wins the sticks) and Clear the Ground (if you collect the last 2 cards on the table, you also receive a plain card from each opponent's collection).
4. Point values differ slightly; in Go Stop, collecting all 5 brights typically gives you 15 points. In Flower Battle, you receive 10 points.

The original version comes with a deck of cards and a pouch of color counting sticks for keeping score.

boardgame.name: Mythrules
boardgame.description:
User summary:

Mythrules was published in only about 100 copies, distributed at a convention ca. 1978. It was designed as a variant of Dungeons & Dragons, though makes no mention of that game, and eventually was considered wholly original by the authors. It cites The Arduin Grimoire 1: The Arduin Grimoire as an influence and presents an original system for spells and magic partially derived from the Earthsea stories of Ursula K. LeGuin".

The rulebook is divided roughly into three parts of equal length - character creation, spellcasting and magic, and combat.

boardgame.name: Heart of Oak
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Rules for Naval Warfare, 1755-1815.

User summary:

Miniatures combat rules for naval battles using scale miniatures.

boardgame.name: Promotions and Prizes
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Roleplay an individual officer in the Queen's navy. struggle to be given greater rank while avoiding court martial, intrigue, and naturally, death in battle. Will you retire a wealthy admiral, or will you be retired to the briny depths?

boardgame.name: Dungeon Bowl
boardgame.description:
In Dungeon Bowl, you are the coach of a team from one of the eight Colleges of Magic. You must hunt down the ball in a dangerous dungeon while avoiding traps, jumping between portals and rummaging through chests to find unimaginable treasures, all in the name of glory, pride and touchdowns.

You decide the line-up and the tactics, but remember: victories are not the most important thing, the most important thing is the blood you pour trying to win!

Dungeon Bowl is an underground Blood Bowl game for two players. The School of Fire and School of Shadows face off in a customizable layout dungeon, filled with portals to jump through and chests to loot. Will you be able to score a touchdown or will you end up getting caught up in cheating and opponents? This box includes everything you need to start your adventure and get that delicious touchdown.,The teams are represented by coloured plastic miniatures, and push-fit assembly is required before use. The game is expandable, and additional rules and teams will be made available through expansion sets and supplements.

Actions in the game are resolved through the use of dice. Regular six-sided dice are used to make tests in a number of cases, such as when a player attempts to pick up the ball, pass it, catch it or dodge past an enemy player. Custom dice are used when one player wishes to Block another, using graphics to represent each of the different (but all violent) potential outcomes.

En Dungeon Bowl, eres el entrenador de un equipo de uno de los ocho Colegios de la Magia. Deberás dar caza al balón en una peligrosa mazmorra mientras evitas trampas, saltas entre portales y rebuscas en cofres para encontrar tesoros inimaginables, todo en nombre de la gloria, el orgullo y los touchdowns.

Tú decides la alineación y las tácticas, pero recuerda: las victorias no son lo más importante, ¡lo más importante es la sangre que viertes intentando ganar!

Dungeon Bowl es un juego de Blood Bowl subterráneo para dos jugadores. El Colegio del Fuego y el de las Sombras se enfrentan en una mazmorra de distribución personalizable, llena de portales por los que saltar y cofres que expoliar. ¿Podrás marcar un touchdown o acabarás pasto de las trampas y los oponentes?

Esta caja incluye todo lo que necesitas para empezar tu aventura y conseguir ese delicioso touchdown.

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

listing.notes: Unopened. Still sealed.

I offer the GERMAN version of the game.
All models are assembled and unpainted. The box has a small damage as you can see in the pictures.
Please note: I will only ship to countries in the EU.
Postage: - Germany: 6 € - EU: 16 €

boardgame.name: Pillars of Eternity II: Deadfire – Critical Role Pack
boardgame.description: This DLC adds 8 new player voice sets and character portraits based on characters from the Vox Machina campaign. Let your player character sound like Grog, Keyleth, Percy, Vax, Vex, Scanlan, Pike, and Gilmore!
boardgame.videogamecharacter: Lord Percival Fredrickstein von Musel Klossowski de Rolo III

boardgame.name: Overruled By Cats
boardgame.description:
A cat themed card game that is as simple to play like UNO but you can perform fast-paced combos with smooth interactive gameplay.

Each player starts out with 8-10 cards depending on the amount of people playing. The goal is to get rid of your hand as fast as possible but if someone goes out that won't necessarily end the game. Drawing cards is not a punishment. If another player plays a counter active card against the player that went out then that player won't win and that will give someone the opportunity to either stop that player or steal the win from that player.

The unique factor of this game creates simple interaction during any player's turn where the game still flows forward without ever stalling or back tracking which brings an enjoyable experience for everyone.

The possibilities can be endless and unpredictable. Every card was developed to never start out with a bricked hand, which will bring the quality to the game where no one ever feels as if they're at a disadvantage to win.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Steal
boardgame.description:
Steal is a fast and furious new letter game of cunning, treachery and outright theft! A hugely exciting game from New Zealand, with all letter tiles contained in a handy mask-shaped fabric bag, allowing it to be played almost anywhere. Steal is suitable for 2-8 players of all ages, easy to learn but more difficult to master.

Play proceeds by flipping tiles (every 2-3 seconds), with players calling out and forming three+ letter words from the exposed letters. As the game proceeds, the aim then is to steal words from your opponents by adding one or more letters. So pin might be stolen as pain, and stolen again as inapt, then pliant, implant, platinum, manipulate, planetarium, perambulating etc....! All the while other words are of course being formed and stolen.

The set contains ten coloured STEAL letters which double the score of the word, so the highest scores are always obtained by assembling/stealing long words containing a coloured letter. Play is further enhanced by the mask (joker) tile which can be any letter you want (& can change as the word is stolen).

Flipping stops while words are being assembled (with the last assembler being next to flip) but stealing does not. So often a word is stolen whilst it is being formed with the addition of an already-exposed new letter! Frustrating and hilarious at the same time, bringing out the competitive streak of everyone who plays. Once all letters are flipped and no more words can be made or stolen...the scores are counted up to find the winner.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Uuhraah!
boardgame.description:
User summary:

Uuhraah! is a role-playing game set in a prehistoric world featuring cavemen and dinosaurs. The rules focus primarily on a simple combat system.

Sessions were intended to last less than an hour; campaigns were envisioned to be only a few sessions in length.

boardgame.name: Twists
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Harrowing chases, raging gunfights, EXPLOSIONS . . . GURPS Action can get wild! Yet the action genre is conservative in its way: The setting is urban or industrial, the heroes' place in society is cosmetic, and natural laws are stretched but rarely broken – it's real life, extra guns, hold the taxes. And like ordering the same meal every time, always sticking to a formula can get boring.

GURPS Action 8: Twists aims to shake things up. It adds back in three of the things that Action filtered out of GURPS: jobs and social standing, the exotic and the supernatural, and wilderness adventures without fancy gadgets. And it does so with the attention to simplicity and streamlining that the core volumes brought to sneaking, shooting, and driving too fast.

Sometimes, the boss wants you to come out of retirement to hunt an alien in the jungle.

boardgame.name: Beasts & Barrows
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Beasts & Barrows is an uncomplicated fantasy role-playing game for 2-5 players + Game Maestro.

boardgame.name: What They Don't Tell You About Dragon Hoards
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

When it does come a time when the brave heroes vanquish the evil dragon and claim for themselves its hoard; many forget that sometimes the true value lies not in the pile...but in the beast itself. Dragons are creatures of magic, whose aura itself morphs the land into their liking. Who in their right mind could measure the worth of a coin against the true value of draconic blood?

boardgame.name: JOME
boardgame.description:
A Malaysian-made card game that incorporates strategy and competitive gameplay. Players accumulate trophy cards by winning battles. This addictive and fun game is guaranteed to light up your day. (description at back of box)

The game consists of trophy cards which are worth point values, and duel cards, which have duel points and are used to compete for the trophy cards. At setup, a number of stacks of trophy cards are laid out to match the number of players. Players are dealt 6 duel cards.

During play, players take turns to play duel cards next to the trophy stacks. Duel cards have different strengths and abilities. Once a third duel card is played next to a trophy stack, that stack is evaluated and the player with the highest duel card strength wins the stack. The stack is then replenished.

Duel cards come in different suits, and each type of trophy stack only accepts specific suits.

The game ends when the trophy deck runs out. For a shorter game, play to a fixed number of points instead.

boardgame.name: Pax Viking: Promo Pack 1
boardgame.description:
Pax Viking promo pack 1

5 all new rule tiles - During setup you may choose or draw one to use in the game

5 new Saga tiles - Add one, some or all to a game as you prefer.

boardgame.name: Annual errata card pack 2021
boardgame.description:
The annual errata card pack includes:

Bios: Origins
cards nr: BO.053, BO.070, BO.082, BO.046, BO.203, BO.078, BO.049, BO.194, BO.069

Bios:Genesis
cards nr: 18. Calvin cycle

High Frontier 4 All 6h player add on
mini punch out and card:

2 outpost markers for player grey, 2 player grey, Dry markers Wet marker for the three fuel types, Spacecraft card for the 6th player

Pax Viking
tile nr: PV010, PV038

1. NOTE, the errata cards for Bios series is included in Bios:Mesofauna.
2. NOTE, if you have Bios:Megafauna and Bios:Genesis the second print run 2020 Longpack batchnr: 251052 then you should have received errata cards with your order. If you have not received these errata cards then you can write an email to info@iongamedesign.com
boardgame.boardgameaccessory: High Frontier 4 All: 6th Player Component Kit

boardgame.name: Once Best Friends
boardgame.description:
Some friendships end with words thrown across the room, flung like stones, meant to hurt and sever. But most friendships end because you drift apart. Not because you want to, necessarily, but you do. More than anything, this holds true for childhood friendships. One day, you wake up and realize that you have become a different person. And so has your best friend. You look at each other, and you know: Where just a few months ago, nothing could have come between the two of you, you are now worlds apart.

Did you take the first step, or did they? Did either of you try to stop it? Would it have mattered? Life went on, swallowed you up, and sent you off in different directions. And so, time went by.

One day, you are back in your hometown. Just stopping by, paying a visit over the holidays. You are grabbing a coffee at this new place that was not here the last time you visited. And in a crowd of unknown faces, you spot one that you know intimately. It has changed, but you would still recognize it anywhere. Your eyes meet, and you can tell that, for both of you, this is what you expected least.

Before you know it, you have walked over. It is awkward at first. But then, as if you had planned to all along, you grab a table along with the coffee. And talk. About the good times, about the things that were not so good, and how, eventually, you grew apart. You cannot tell if this is a new beginning, or if it even should be one. But right now, that is not important. You stay in the moment, as you relive memories—good and bad—with someone with whom you were once best friends.

Once Best Friends is a melancholic slice-of-life roleplaying game (RPG) for two meant to be played as a one-shot. It needs very little preparation and focuses on improvised storytelling. One the following pages, you find guidance on how to run the game, memory prompts, and an empty glass jar you will fill with tokens of your shared childhood memories. Since you can work with as many memory prompts as you like, a session can last anywhere from one to three hours.

(Game intro from the PDF)

boardgame.name: The Last Day of Rose: A Malign Age
boardgame.description:
The Last Day of Rose: A Malign Age is a cooperative card game for 3-5 players. Players will take on the roles of friends and relatives of Rose, a girl with severe depression and suicidal thoughts. Players will need to work together to the best of their abilities to accompany and care for Rose through multiple scenarios, each with their own unique challenges.

On a player’s turn, he or she must play a card from his/her hand which he/she has drawn from his/her character’s unique deck. All the cards have two kinds of effects to choose: a positive one might let player help with Rose’s wellbeing or add a more powerful card to their decks etc. A negative one will harm Rose’s mental state or add a harmful card to a player’s deck etc. All cards from the players’ hands must be played (or discarded) in order to complete a round, yet each player can only resolve a limited number of positive effects depending on the efforts they can spend.

The game is won if Rose's is saved.

boardgame.name: Smarties-spelet
boardgame.description: During 1989, the company Smarties, which makes chocolate candy, released a free board game in Sweden. The game was called the "Smarties game" and was available in stores for free if you bought a package of Smarties. The game also appeared for free in some comic books. Smarties used chocolate candy as game pieces and the winner got to eat all the game pieces. It's a simple roll and move game. First in goal wins. Each player start with 5 Smarties, during the game you can win or lose Smarties. If you down to zero Smarties you out of the game.

boardgame.name: Seekers of the Un-K'nown
boardgame.description:
From the Kickstarter:

You have heard it told: during the Protracted Cataclysm of the 2nd Epoch, this dying planet was clinched in war with an invasive alien force known as the "Destrageists." Hailing from beyond the red planet, the Space Probe Agency called upon the heroes of the era to prepare a defense against these fungal lifeforms. There are (rather melodic) epic ballads that tell the tale of Rogo Kahn - a cunning military strategist - and Zee L'Gar - an ostentatious futurist and inventor. These two culled their might to lead an army of well-trained and technologically-aided ancients to combat these foreign invaders. Possibly ending the cataclysm and uniting the "nay-shuns" of the ancients, this duo and their shock-troops seemingly couldn't be stopped. Yes, the grandeur of their exploits is something of mythology now, but even respectable elders sometimes admit a deep-seated belief that such characters might might have been real and that their fabled base, Quartum-Q - with all its technological enchantments might exist!

This sounds familiar...

Seekers of the Un-K'nown is the first adventure being produced for our Classics Mutated line. This line pays both homage and parody to some of the foundational RPG adventures we all know and love. BE ONE with your gaming group as you re-explore some of these marvelous scenarios of your youth, now re-imagined into the radiation-baked whimsy of Terra A.D.
boardgame.rpg: Mutant Crawl Classics Role Playing Game

boardgame.name: Cirkus-spelet
boardgame.description: In the comic book "Kalle Anka & C: o", no. 21, 21 May 1984 was a simple roll and move game with circus theme (Kalle Anka is the Swedish name for Donald Duck). Cirkusspelet is a simple roll and move game where the first in goal wins. If there is a square with a number, read the instructions and follow them.

boardgame.name: Kalle Ankas bokstavsspel
boardgame.description: Flip a subject card in the pile, then flip a letter card from the other pile. Start the timer at 3 minutes. Everyone writes down words they can think of about the subject and the letter to collect points. The one with the most points after 5 rounds wins. The game was included in the comic magazin "Kalle Anka & C:0", nr. 8, 18 February 1991 (Kalle Anka is the swedish name for Donald Duck).

boardgame.name: Jakten på Spökplumpen
boardgame.description:
A game that was included in "Kalle Anka & C: o", no. 34, 22 August 1988 (Kalle Anka is the Swedish name for Donald Duck).

In Jakten på spökplumpen you have a round disc with white dots on it with a bowl of water next to it. Each round, dip a finger in the water bowl and rub on a white dot so you see the clue. Then everyone guesses where "Spökplumpen" is hiding. The one who guesses correctly wins and if no one guesses correctly, it is the next player's turn. This person dips a finger in the water bowl and rubs on a white dot to see the clue, then everyone guesses where "Spökplumpen" is hiding. This is how the game goes on until someone has guessed "Spökplumpen's" hiding place. Whoever guesses correctly wins.

boardgame.name: Knatte-kul i Jul
boardgame.description: A simple roll and move game with a Christmas theme that was included in "Kalle Anka & C: o", no. 52/53, 21 December 1992 (Kalle Anka is the Swedish name for Donald Duck). Each turn roll the die and move. If you end up in a red square with a number, read the instruction for that square and follow it. First in goal wins.

boardgame.name: Spöktåget
boardgame.description:
In Spöktåget (the Ghost Train), it is important to figure out which Disney passenger is in which ghost carriage and conquer as many passenger pieces as possible.

In turn, you choose a piece with a Disney passenger, put it in a ghost carriage and push it into one of the three ghost tunnels. When there are three ghost wagons in each tunnel, the game starts. Before the next turn player pushes a new ghost carriage into a tunnel, the player must guess which Disney passenger is in the ghost carriage coming out of that particular tunnel at the other end first. If the player guesses correctly, he gets the passenger piece and is allowed to continue. If the guess is wrong, the piece is put back in the pile of Disney passengers and the next player takes over. So the game continues. Guess which passenger comes out and pushes a new carriage into that tunnel. Lose and win pieces. The game is over when all ghost carriages are empty. The one with the most pieces wins.

A game with a ghost theme that was included in "Kalle Anka & C: o", no. 45, 8 November 1993 (Kalle Anka is the Swedish name for Donald Duck).

boardgame.name: サバンナラッシュ (Savannah Rush)
boardgame.description:
サバンナラッシュ (Savannah Rush) is a placement game from Japan.

Will it be the elephant or the lion that rules the savannah? The giraffe? A monkey? Rats?
You are one of the gods of the savannah. Your job is to bring the animals to live there. Place your favourite animals in the best places!

This is a battle game where you have to place the animals on the map. The game is played with five different types of animals, and the aim is to place them in such a way that the two animals you are in charge of will have an advantage and you will score more victory points. Use the other animals to your advantage.

サバンナを制するのはゾウかライオンか？それともキリン？サル？ネズミ？
あなたはサバンナを司る神々のひとり。 動物たちをサバンナに住まわせるのが仕事。 贔屓の動物をより良い土地に住まわせよう！

マップ上に動物コマを配置して対戦する陣取りゲームです。
５種類の動物の特徴を活かして、自分が担当する2種類の動物が有利になるように巧みに配置し、より多く勝利点を獲得することを目指します。担当以外の動物もうまく利用しましょう。
publisher's summary
boardgame.boardgamepublisher: iop games (イオピーゲームズ)

boardgame.name: Starmine Rummy Pocket
boardgame.description:
Starmine Rummy Pocket is a card game from Japan for one or two players. The players are trying to set off fireworks all at once until the finale with a Starmine. This is a firework trick which is made by arranging the sections.

Starmine Rummy Pocket is part of a series of pocket games for 1-2 players, produced by the publisher JUGAME STUDIO (ジュゲムスタジオ). Currently, there is no plan to produce a larger game of Starmine Rummy.
user summary

A lot of fireworks are shot off incessantly. The sound of the whistle and the smoke and the light and the roar which roars far above the expectation.

A starmine is a firework display that features a series of fireworks that are connected together. As a pyrotechnist, you aim to create the most memorable starmine of all.

The starmine consists of three columns (opening, main and finale). Place the firework card combinations in all three rows to complete the starmine. It is important to take your time to collect all the cards in order to create the best starmine, but the highlight of the starmine is the continuous firing! You can't just sit back and collect fireworks, because your rivals will be setting them off one after another. Try to complete your fireworks before the deck runs out and all the fireworks are set up.

フィナーレまで一気に花火を打ち上げろ。 役を揃えてつくる仕掛け花火。

多数の花火を絶え間なく打ち上げる。
鳴り続ける笛の音と立ち込める煙。そして予想よりもはるか上空に轟く光と轟音。

スターマインは、複数の花火を連結して打ち上げる、連射が特徴の仕掛け花火です。
あなたは花火職人として、誰よりも心に残るスターマインの打ち上げを目指します。

スターマインは、３つの列（オープニング、メイン、フィナーレ）で構成されます。
３つ全ての列に花火カードを組み合わせを配置してスターマインを完成させましょう。

より良いスターマインを完成させるには、じっくりカードを集めることが大切ですが、スターマインは連射が見どころ！ライバルも次々に花火を設置していくため、ゆっくりと花火を集めてばかりはいられません。 山札が尽き、全ての花火が設置されてしまう前に花火を完成させ、ライバルよりも印象的なスターマインを打ち上げましょう。
publisher's summary
boardgame.boardgamepublisher: JUGAME STUDIO (ジュゲムスタジオ)

listing.notes:
New in shrink.
Buyer pays shipping. Payment by Paypal/Zelle/Venmo. Local pickup in DC also welcome, in which case cash is acceptable.
US shipping only.

boardgame.name: Galaxis: Stellar Frontiers
boardgame.description:
Galaxis: Stellar Frontiers is a scenario-based competitive sci-fi strategy game for 2-4 players where each scenario brings you into one of the many battles going on in a galactic-wide war. During the game you will build a thriving economy to fuel the battle while expanding your area of control with fleets of ships.

Gameplay:
In Galaxis: Stellar Frontiers, you assume the role of one of four unique galactic factions fighting for resources and territory. At the beginning of every turn, you collect resources from fields you control which you can spend on constructing Buildings on Planets, buying Ships, and researching Ship Upgrades to improve them. By moving your Ships into new fields, you expand your reach to get more resources and trigger Events which help you grow even faster. By growing your economy, you’re able to unlock new building tiers to bring the war the next level. Each faction follows their very own goals in the scenarios to gain Influence, and the one with the most influence points at the end wins the battle and one day, possibly the war.

boardgame.name: Castle: Deck 1
Castle: Starter deck
boardgame.description:
Welcome to Castle, the game of fighting creatures and obstacles.

Start off with 40 points and see who will be the winner in the end! The first one who loses all their points, loses the game!

Players draft 1-2 cards to battle and inflict damage on each other. Object cards can increase or decrease a player's stamina. The first person to lose all 40 of their stamina points, loses the game.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Horse & Musket: Annual #4
boardgame.description:
Horse and Musket Annual Number 4 is the fourth fan expansion to Horse & Musket. It will add new scenarios for owners of Volumes I-V and Horse & Matchlock.

The scenarios include...

Alford – July 2, 1645 – “I found myself so slighted”

Mohács – August 12, 1687 – 1526 Avenged

Almenar – July 27, 1710 – Stanhope’s Great Charge

Bassignana – September 27, 1745 – Bourbon High Tide in Italy

Rocoux – October 11, 1746 –

Hochkirk – October 14, 1758 –

Trenton – December 26, 1776 – “Victory or death”

Assunpink Creek – January 2, 1777 – “we’ve got the old fox safe now.”

Bennigton – August 16, 1777 – “They are ours, or this night Molly Stark sleeps a widow!”

Kings Mountain – October 7, 1780 – “...lay waste your country with fire and sword.”

Valmy – September 20, 1792 – “Vive la Nation!”

First Abukir – July 25, 1799 – Jochim Murat’s Bold Charge

Jena – October 14, 1806 – “…if he were alive we wouldn’t be here today.”

Talavera – July, 27-28, 1809 – “My God! What is an army without a chief?”

Smolensk – August 17, 1812 – Napoléon Takes “the gateway to Old Russia”

Borodino – September 7, 1812 – “Soldiers, face to the enemy! Let us go and get killed!”

Berezina – November 28, 1812 – Perilous Winter Crossing

Lützen – May 2, 1813 – Napoleon’s Bloody Return to Prussia

Bautzen – May 20-21, 1813 – The Truce of Pläswitz

Horseshoe Bend – March 27, 1814 – “Once I could animate my warriors; but I cannot animate the dead.”
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Horse & Matchlock: Prelude to an Era
Horse & Musket II: Sport of Kings
Horse & Musket III: Crucible of War
Horse & Musket IV: Tides of Revolution
Horse & Musket: Dawn of an Era

boardgame.name: CoderMarz
boardgame.description:
WELCOME TO PLANET MARS!
It's the year 2090. Your spaceship has just landed on Mars. Captain Capability, Captain Courage, Captain Creativity, and Captain Compassion need to be able to train themselves on Mars to collect supplies in order to help them settle. But here's the twist - to help the astronauts survive, you are the Master Mind. Your astronaut needs to collect all the supplies and essentials to survive on Mars and you can use your predictive instincts to do so.

Building on the core game mechanics of Coder Mindz, this game adds set collection and learning about the planet Mara and space exploration to combine both AI and astronomy education. The idea is easy - play a board game, help the astronauts explore Mars, visit various places, collect necessary supplies, and a lot more. All in a fun and exciting Martian Adventure!

Learning Coding and AI concepts help you connect with real coding and AI.

boardgame.name: Althing: Sous le signe d'Hela
boardgame.description:
Althing is the first expansion to the game Althing with 22 new cards. It includes a set of modules, complementary or independent, that will renew your games and the way you approach Althing, even in solo mode.

- Thorfinn legend (solo mode)
- Coward troll
- An epic under the sign of Hela : Add Hela cards under the step cards to add special effects to those steps
- Stridur and Bolvun : this module adds 2 new step cards with special effects.
- Loki, Tyr, Idunn are new player cards with new effects
- Jotünn : new vikking card with more options to trick your opponents

If you want to win, you still have to speed up your opponents in the race for the throne... But with this expansion you have new challenges to face, and new options to win!

boardgame.name: Deluxe Fortune Deck
boardgame.description:
Publisher Summary:

Deluxe Fortune Deck:
The Everway Fortune Deck is a collection of 36 cards that represent fundamental principles or animating forces at play in our everyday lives, with some resemblances to the Major Arcana of a tarot deck. The Fortune Deck focuses more on relationships and groups of meaning.

Deluxe Season Deck:
The Everway Season Deck is an expansion to the primary Fortune Deck. It is a collection of 40 additional cards in four suits of 10 cards each, based on the four seasons of the year. The Season Deck is inspired by the Minor Arcana of a tarot deck and reflects the temporal passage of time.

boardgame.name: Althing: Coronation promo card
boardgame.description:
Promo card that can be obtained during boardgames events.
It can replace the basic Thing / Althing card.

It shows the coronation a little closer, but requires different conditions to be reached.

Thing - promo side : requires 3 gold, 3 wood, 2 bones
Althing - promo side : requires 3 gold, 3 wood, 4 bones

boardgame.name: Althing: Butik Promo Card
boardgame.description:
Promo card that can be obtained as a goodies when buying the game or picking up the game pre ordered in a game shop.
It can replace the basic Thing / Althing card, the last step of the race.

It represents a game shop in a viking village, and requires the same conditions than the Althing: promo card to be reached.

Thing - Butik side : requires 3 gold, 3 wood, 2 bones
Althing - Butik side : requires 3 gold, 3 wood, 4 bones

boardgame.name: Vudù: Bad Box
boardgame.description:
Ancient sorcery, dark omens and endless curses — you will become one of the adepts of the dark magic of the Egyptians or a follower of the ancient art of the Badly Dead Druids or an arcane sorcerer of Vudù rituals! Prepare yourselves for the biggest dispute of black magic ever. The Vudù tournament has just begun!

In Vudù, the players act as the most wicked and malicious sorcerers of all time, and they want to use their curses and black magic to make the lives of their enemies impossible to prevail over them!

But wait... many expansions came after Vudù... each one more cruel than the previous. So, to collect them all, you don't need a BIG box, you need a BAD box.

It contains the base box and these expansions:
Double Trouble
Ninja VS Pigmei
Zombi VS Barbari
Mostri VS Alieni

boardgame.name: Symposium: A Game About Asking Questions
boardgame.description:
Symposium is a Descended From The Queen storytelling card game for 3-8 players, simulating a philosophical dinner party (or "symposium") in the classical style of the ancient Greek world and based on Plato's work of the same name, with some modifications to make it more accessible to a modern audience.

In the game you play guests at dinner party filled with interesting people: philosophers, poets, doctors, playwrights, and many others. All the best things in life are there: good food, wine, beautiful servants, and interesting conversation. You are a guest, and after you get comfortable your host makes a request of you: make a speech in praise of love. Every guest gives a speech, the contents of which are directed by a different metaphysical perspective. If your speech is the best one, the host will award you the relevant card.

After this initial round of play the role of host shifts, new perspectives are selected, and a new Question card is drawn by a new host; introducing the players to a variety of interesting questions. (What is is to be wise? What is courage? Why do I still love them?) Fresh speeches are given, and the card is awarded. Play continues in this manner until the You are drunk card is selected, at which point the game is over. The guest with the most cards at the end of the game not only wins, but is also the wisest.

boardgame.name: Disgruntled Decks: Navy Edition
boardgame.description:
From the publisher's website:

Disgruntled Decks is a card game for military service members and grizzled Veterans who enjoy laughing together about their time in the service. With a unique blend of descriptive language and military themes, Disgruntled Decks gives one more reason for service members and Veterans to talk about their shared experiences while having fun in the process.
We strongly believe that humor is healing, and some Veterans still have a good amount of healing left to do. We hope to provide some of that humor with Disgruntled Decks.
Disgruntled Decks can be played by itself or used as an unofficial military Cards Against Humanity ® third party expansion.

Disgruntled Decks
The Original Card Game For Veterans.™

boardgame.name: The Search for the Seastone - Part 1
boardgame.description:
From Patreon:

It's time for the first Colostle single player guided campaign, 'The Search for the Seastone'! This module is the first part of a guided adventure and story for your character as they follow the rumours of legend to the mysterious Crown Isle, in search of a treasure unlike any other.

This module contains the first part, along with special rules and explanation for how the campaign will work. Parts 2 and 3 will follow in the subsequent months, completing your epic quest. It's up to you when you partake of this adventure and how you sew it into your character's current adventures.

boardgame.name: Through the Ages: A New Story of Civilization – The Broken Token Organizer
boardgame.description:
Build your civilization, lead your militaries, discover new technology, and guide your nation to victory. Be the strong leader your nation leads, and let the organization come from your humble advisors at The Broken Token.

Features:

Compatible with Through the Ages: A New Story of Civilization (2016)
2 card trays
Dividers to separate the player count
1 additional card tray to hold cards that are replaced in the expansion
4 player trays to hold the starting amount of game cubes
4 trays to hold excess game cubes
Game boards lock in place for transport
Accommodates the Following Expansions:

New Leaders and Wonders Expansion (2020)

This is an officially licensed box organizer compatible with Through the Ages by Czech Games Edition.
boardgame.boardgameaccessory: Through the Ages: A New Story of Civilization
Through the Ages: New Leaders and Wonders

boardgame.name: Ghost Stories: The Broken Token Organizer
boardgame.description:
The border between life and death is weakening, and the ancient threat of return made by Wu-Feng is imminent. While you engage in the battle between Fat-Si and Wu-Feng, our organizer will help minimize the mess.

Organizer can hold the base game, White Order, Black Secret, Infernal Dice and tiles and cards promo
16 removable trays: 4 trays to hold miniatures and dice, 1 tray to hold cardboard artifact tokens, 1 tray to hold tiles and standee, 1 card tray, 4 player trays, 3 trays to hold expansion tokens, 1 Qi token tray, 1 character abilities tokens tray.
The border is now broken, the howls of the dead fills the air. It is time to stop the incoming waves, for if you don’t, there will be no one else who will stop Wu-Feng this time.

boardgame.name: 2020: The Board Game – 2021 Extension Pack +
boardgame.description: With the 2021: Extension Pack +, players will encounter 54 exclusive social media cards that give players the opportunity to keep their game current with events inspired by the year 2021.

boardgame.name: Do You Know Me? Expansion Pack
boardgame.description: It’s about to get personal with the Do You Know Me? Expansion Pack! Find out how well you really know your friends with 180 new hilarious and oh-no-you-didn't questions to add to the Do You Know Me? Core game.

boardgame.name: Catan Goodies: Plush Robbers
Catan Scenarios: Plush Robbers
Catan: Die Stoffräuber
boardgame.description:
The second set of accessories in the Catan Goodies line (the first Catan Goodies set consisted of the Catanimals) features a set of three plush robber figures. These three figures are plush representations of “Teuber’s Robbers”: three characters named Chief, Lucky, and Bert, who together are the personifications of the robber in Catan. The robbers were originally envisioned to be hapless and ultimately harmless characters who are constantly being vilified by the people settling on Catan.

As with the Catanimals, the rules of a scenario using these plush figures was made available, although in this case the rules were only made available in the German language from the Catan website.

Rules:
In a 3-4 player game, only two of the plush robbers are used. In a 5-6 player game, all three of the plush robbers are used.

At the start of the game, none of the plush robbers are under the control of any player. A player may take control of one of the plush robbers if they have one of their hand cards stolen as a result of robber movement.

Once all of the plush robbers have been claimed, whenever a player has one of their hand cards stolen as a result of robber movement, the player having their card stolen may take a plush robber from the player stealing the card. If the player stealing the card does not have a plush robber, they may take a plush robber from any other player.

A player with control of one plush robber has their hand limit increased by three cards (they do not lose resources unless they have more than 10 cards, instead of the usual 7).

The robber may not be moved to any hex where there is an adjacent settlement or city belonging to a player with control of two plush robbers, unless that player is in sole possession of the most victory points.

boardgame.name: Pandemic: State of Emergency – Meeple Source Upgrade Set (28 pcs)
boardgame.description: This 28-piece wooden upgrade set for Pandemic: State of Emergency includes 24 vaccine doses and 4 vaccine factories.

boardgame.name: Pandemic: Meeple Source Research Center Upgrade Pack
boardgame.description: 6-Piece Research Center Upgrade Pack (Compatible with Pandemic)

boardgame.name: Council of 12: Playmat
boardgame.description:
This handy play mat not only looks pretty, but makes it easier to keep track of the problems you're struggling with. And it even fits in the game box!

Note: You will probably have to remove the inlay for this.

boardgame.name: A Quiet Midwinter
A Quiet Midwinter: An Old School Heist with the Hallmarks of a Holiday Special
boardgame.description:
From itch.io:

In the time of legends, when the gods, fey, and demons finished their war, they signed their peace treaty on Midwinter Night in the village of Quiet. Midwinter has been sacred throughout the known lands ever since, and Quiet’s Midwinter celebration is legendary. Once a year, on Midwinter Night, Vidah the Divine Seer receives a message from the demons of the gorge and the gods of the mountain, naming those of the mortal world who the gods and demons agree are the exceptionally virtuous and exceptionally wicked. Vidah brings the list, which everyone calls the “Naughty & Nice List,” to Quiet and gives it to the fey ambassador Archon Winter.

But this year, Vidah is missing, Archon Winter is drinking, and everyone in town is struggling to find the Midwinter Spirit. That means it's a perfect time to steal something, whether it's Archon Winter's gifts, the Divine Seer's missing list, the mayor's pre-signed requisition papers, or even just the town's spirits.

This heist adventure for low levels includes five locations, over a dozen NPCs, an airship pulled by flying wolfhounds, multiple townsfolk facing holiday crises, and even a lightly cursed treasure or two.

Inspired by holiday films with certain... Hallmarks.

boardgame.name: Nightmare at Dodmans Point
boardgame.description:
From itch.io:

In the time of legends, when the gods, fey, and demons finished their war, they signed their peace treaty on Midwinter Night in the village of Quiet. Midwinter has been sacred throughout the known lands ever since, and Quiet’s Midwinter celebration is legendary. Once a year, on Midwinter Night, Vidah the Divine Seer receives a message from the demons of the gorge and the gods of the mountain, naming those of the mortal world who the gods and demons agree are the exceptionally virtuous and exceptionally wicked. Vidah brings the list, which everyone calls the “Naughty & Nice List,” to Quiet and gives it to the fey ambassador Archon Winter.

But this year, Vidah is missing, Archon Winter is drinking, and everyone in town is struggling to find the Midwinter Spirit. That means it's a perfect time to steal something, whether it's Archon Winter's gifts, the Divine Seer's missing list, the mayor's pre-signed requisition papers, or even just the town's spirits.

This heist adventure for low levels includes five locations, over a dozen NPCs, an airship pulled by flying wolfhounds, multiple townsfolk facing holiday crises, and even a lightly cursed treasure or two.

Inspired by holiday films with certain... Hallmarks.

boardgame.name: Solar System Voyager
boardgame.description:
Turn-based strategy about running a space agency and exploring the solar system in the new space race. Each player takes on the role of one of the 5 space agencies, and in his turn can perform two of the 9 possible actions, such as developing the agency on the technology tree, launching a rocket, conducting research, placing buildings, or sabotage.

The game board is a model of the Solar System, consisting of 5 movable rings. On each ring there are successive objects of the Solar System, and the rings are divided into such numbers of squares, that rotating each of the rings by 1 square per round, the speed of planets and rockets on their orbits around the Sun is maintained according to Kepler's law!

Once all players have made their move, we rotate each ring and the positions of the planets and rockets change. This means that players, in order to optimize their missions and not waste valuable time, must learn to predict the future position of planets and start planning rocket launches in advance, just like real space agencies.

Development tree is divided into three branches: space tourism, base construction and sabotage. Players have to manage their budget on an ongoing basis, so they don't run out of funds at the crucial moment of the space race. In addition, each of the space agencies: USA, Russia, Europe, China and Japan, has its own unique bonus.

—description from the designer

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

boardgame.name: A Trip Down Memory Mine
boardgame.description:
From itch.io:

This Pathfinder Second Edition mini-adventure is meant to be run for a party of 2 to 4 level 7 characters.

Help Eldora by rescuing her wife from the depths of a mine where rare mushrooms grow, featuring a creature-hazard combo that can turn even a simple dungeon into a labyrinth.

boardgame.name: Don't F#ckin Die
boardgame.description:
From itch.io:

Don't F#ckin Die is a gritty rules lite Pocket Zine TTRPG with OSR flavorings. This is a minimal rule set meant for quick and brutal play. The only thing that is certain in this game is that you will die... and be reborn again, and again, and again...

WHAT YOU NEED TO PLAY
- A handful of your typical polyhedral TTRPG dice.
- Copies of the game printed out for each player.
- The Adventure of your choosing.

boardgame.name: Operation Shadow
boardgame.description:
Game Box:

In a world characterised by warring factions, greedy mercenaries and dwindling global resources, political leaders have their work cut out for them. But sometimes it takes more than a handshake to bring peace to troubled times.

When conflict on the Ixan border reaches crisis point, they know who to call ... Jay Solano! This one-man army will enforce peace by any means necessary!

boardgame.name: Alas Poor Otto
boardgame.description:
From the publishers blurb:

The wizard Inclulas is dead – a spiked club to the back of the head has that effect no matter how many scrolls you own. Brigands have looted his body within sight of his manse, and his scrolls disintegrate into the bloody mud around him. His servant, Ottö, saw the murder, but his presence in the backlit doorway scared the murderers away - for the time being. Now Ottö has retreated to the alchemical workshop, to help himself to all the liquor he can find. He has inadvertently mixed several potions together in his guts, and the weird magical concoction has had peculiar effects...

boardgame.name: Somethingly
boardgame.description:
Somethingly is the new, side-splittingly silly, party game from Toffee Hammer. Players perform Do This! actions in a ‘Somethingly’ way for other players to guess: Dance like you’re at a disco… suspiciously! Mime drinking tea… angrily! Shake hands with someone… mysteriously! Anyone who likes charades, will love Somethingly!

Included in the box are suggestions for three different types of gameplay: ‘Inclusively’ for families and mixed ability groups; ‘Rapidly’ for fast-paced team play; and ‘Competitively’ for individual players.

With 250 Somethingly cards and 150 Do This! Cards there are over 35,000 different possible combinations – making this a game that will last a lifetime. Cards are colour coded for difficulty
so it is easy to adapt for different groups.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Shadows of Brimstone: Dead or Alive Game Supplement
boardgame.description:
Travelling the desert roads and canyon trails is always a risky proposition with outlaws on the prowl. Whether bitter with mutation, risen from a shallow grave, or just looking to make an easy score, the highwaymen around Brimstone are ruthless in their greed for Dark Stone and gold.

This 15-card supplement adds a collection of all new Canyons Encounters and Canyons Artifacts for The Canyons World (found in the Shadows of Brimstone: Other Worlds – Blasted Wastes), as well as new Darkness cards. These cards are themed for finding items and encounters with lawless outlaws and highwaymen travelling the canyon valleys of the Southwest.

CARD LIST

Outlaw Treasure Map ×2
Highwayman's Holster
Highwayman's Shotgun
Gulch Rifle
Bandit's Duster
Life on the Run x2
Nothing Personal
Dark Stone Rage
Stampede!
"Not Yer Business"
Outlaw Camp
"Help! Help!"
Shallow Graves
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Shadows of Brimstone: Other Worlds – Blasted Wastes

boardgame.name: Os 3 Porquinhos
boardgame.description:
Os 3 Porquinhos ("The 3 Little Pigs") is the first volume in a series of fun games based on ancient tales passed down from generation to generation, later grouped into books by writers who became famous for such feats and came to be known as "Fairy Tales".
Here players have to band together to stop the wolf from taking down their houses. For that, they must think strategically and together, as it is a cooperative game.
Build the three houses as quickly as possible by putting an end to the wolf's plans will make the players win!

—description from the designer
boardgame.boardgamefamily: Folk Tales & Fairy Tales: Three Little Pigs

boardgame.name: Christmas Rush
boardgame.description:
Christmas Rush is a family board game themed around Christmas, but playable all year round.

The object of the game is to find and wrap a number of Christmas presents (dealt randomly at the start of the game) and get them back to the Christmas tree. The presents are represented by tiles shuffled and located in pre-set areas on the playing board facedown.

Players move around the board using 2 dice and choose one dice for the number of moves they can make, and the second dice for the number of tiles they can look at once they have completed their move. Presents can be stolen by other players if they are not wrapped, and to wrap you need wrapping paper (collected from key spaces as you move) and then to roll a "Christmas tree" on the dice. Once all presents have been found and wrapped, play moves to the Holly Highway where the race is on back to the tree. Snowflake cards will help or hinder, and naughty elves will send you backwards.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Concordia: Top Shelf Gamer Metal Coin Bundle
boardgame.description:
Contains:
30 copper 26mm diameter 2.5mm thick
15 silver 30mm diameter 2.5mm thick
15 gold 30mm diameter 2.5mm thick
1- 3" x 4" burgundy velvet draw string bag

boardgame.name: Green Messiah
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

HE’S A VERY NAUGHTY BOY! or IT’S NOT EASY BEING GREEN

Years ago, in the quiet Sussex hamlet of Town Littleworth, something from the black extra-cosmic gulfs of space fell from the sky.

Something that a childless couple took in and raised as their son.

In this one act of kindness, they may have doomed the world.
GREEN MESSIAH is a botanical adventure for use with LAMENTATIONS OF THE FLAME PRINCESS WEIRD FANTASY ROLE-PLAYING and other traditional role-playing games. It is suitable for characters of most levels, and vegetarians.

Within you will find an invasive alien species of shape-changing root vegetables, malicious trees, and an extensive menu of delicious – and potentially fatal – fruits and vegetables from another world.

The adventure is best played in a shaded area, watered no more than once a week, and kept indoors in colder months.

boardgame.name: Terror in the Streets
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Paris, 1630.

Europe burns and drowns in blood, but France remains, for the most part, inviolate and strong.

Except now, horror has come to Paris.

The city’s children are going missing. Parents are fearful and paranoid, and the people of Paris are becoming angry and restless.

A mysterious phantom figure is taking the youngsters and taunting the authorities. Can the criminal be found before more children disappear? What is the secret behind the kidnappings?

TERROR IN THE STREETS is a historically-inspired investigative urban horror adventure for characters of most levels, for use with LAMENTATIONS OF THE FLAME PRINCESS WEIRD FANTASY ROLEPLAYING and other traditional role-playing games.

boardgame.name: The Staffortonshire Trading Company Works of John Williams
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

My name is John Benjamin Williams.
I am a English cartographer and architect employed with the Staffortonshire Trading Company.
Small in size, but with powerful connections, the Staffortonshire trade commodities all around the known world, particularly in Europe.
This is what people see me do and hear me say.
However, that is not why I am employed by the Staffortonshire.
For the past twenty years I have travelled the globe as a spy for the English crown.

Now in my sixtieth year, the year of our lord 1674, my health is failing.
Before I lay down with God, I complete and compile the cartographic works created during my travels for the Staffortonshire, and ultimately the English Crown.

John Benjamin Williams - 1674

This book is filled with maps and illustrations based on 17th century historical references to help inspire adventure and create memorable games.

boardgame.name: 6x6x6: The Mayhemic Misssile Method
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Tenscore and Sixteen Ways for Sorcerists, Witches, and Other Thaumatrophs to Defend Their Indefensible Persons

SIX

They can only burn you at the stake if they catch you, and The Mayhemic Misssile Method will make them think twice before trying.

SIX

One first-level spell, two hundred and sixteen flavors. Use everybody’s favorite trio of dice to create dizzying and deadly exceptions to the laws of nature.

SIX

This book turns a familiar, low-level spell into something you might not want your allies, let alone your enemies, to cast.

6x6x6: The Mayhemic Misssile Method (Tenscore and Sixteen Ways for Sorcerists, Witches, and Other Thaumatrophs to Defend Their Indefensible Persons) is a magic supplement for use with Lamentations of the Flame Princess and all other traditional sword-and-sorcery tabletop role-playing games

boardgame.name: The Book of Antitheses
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The time has come to reveal the truth behind role-playing games, their Satanic origin, and how to utilize that truth to manifest true power in the Physical Plane.

THE BOOK OF ANTITHESES contains everything you need to initiate yourself into the left-hand path of role-playing. Learn the secrets of astral travel, telegraphy, divination, ceremonial dice magick, and the binding of demons. Succumb to the knowledge that demons live in us, all around us, and can be yoked like oxen to deliver WEALTH, SEX, and POWER. The second half of the book contains a full Lamentations of the Flame Princess adventure built using the magickal principals herein.

Join us and attain ROCK-HARD OCCULT POWER now!

boardgame.name: In a Deadly Fashion
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

DEATH IS THE NEW BLACK!

A hot new fashion trend is spreading and people are dying to get into these clothes—literally. These clothes are unlike anything ever made before, but is it worth a human life? People are turning up dead or missing and this fashion trend is the reason.

Will your players discover the truth or become fashion victims themselves? Find out in this explosive, decadent, and horrifying adventure for Lamentations of the Flame Princess Weird Fantasy Role-Playing and other traditional tabletop role-playing games.

boardgame.name: Moose Transport
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Moose is a Frontier transport, intended to connect worlds 9 light years apart in one jump. It is useful when looking for new markets and spends most if its time at starports with few facilities. It is not intended to be a warship, but can be fitted with turrets to defend itself. It carries 228 tons of cargo.

You get A3 size deck plans, a description of the interior and design and a supplement called Between Decks. This discusses the ancillary systems that are necessary to make a ship work, but are not covered in the design rules. As such, Between Decks is intended to help the referee with ideas to help make the game more believable. It also includes a few ideas for scenarios.

boardgame.name: Gilded Suns: War of the Principalities
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

For nearly two hundred years, the nations of northern Magbiren have fought each other in a never-ending struggle. This expansion to the GILDED SUNS campaign setting for the First Edition of the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game explores northern Magbiren and the wars they fight for reasons they don’t remember.

Included in this book are over 30 new firearms, epic level progressions for the GILDED SUNS classes, new feats, new airships and tanks, and a detailed gazetteer of the 28 nations of northern Magbiren.

boardgame.name: Harvest Colony
Horn of Plenty
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Your ship got separated from the rest of the convoy in a storm and now you must find your destination on your own. You enter the bay but your captain admits she is new and doesn't have a map due to damage to the map room.

This adventure setting was designed for 5th Edition AD&D for the Filbar Campaign for four, 5th level adventurers and DM.

boardgame.name: One Hundred Plus Magic Events
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Magic and its practice typically plays an important role in many fantasy adventures and campaigns. Whether the adventurers are investigating a mystery or tracking down a notorious villain – magic makes the fantasy journey unpredictable and exciting.
Presented here are 100 unique magic events that are focused on realism and narrative-building roleplay. This list will help you introduce magical elements into your campaign in a more nuanced and believable way.
This is an essential tool and reference that a GM will be able to use over and over again.
1d100 adventure hooks and flavorful events for memorable roleplaying situations
Supernatural / magic references are mostly inspired by historical events, superstition, folklore and fairytales – gives you full control of the tone of your game
Almost exclusively non-combat content – keep using your favorite random encounter tables
Includes 12 additional support tables for excellent variation and further inspiration
Perfect for slice of life, OSR, historical and medieval fantasy games
System Agnostic – use with your favorite RPGs

boardgame.name: The Spellblade Class for Old School RPGs
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A Spellblade is that mesh of magic meets metal. The Spellblade has been trained in both the arcane and martial arts. This combination makes them efficient combatants when thrown into the thick of it. Presented here is the Spellbade character class for your old school RPGs such as Labyrinth Lord, OSR, or the world's oldest RPG.

boardgame.name: The Runeknight Class for Old School RPGs
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A Runeknight is a character class that has the skill to empower their weapons by inscribing magical runes on them. The training that a Runeknight has undergone gives them a keen insight into how magic and weapons can work together to increase their power and effectiveness in battle. This synergy makes them deadly opponents.

boardgame.name: Curious Clerics
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Pathfinder Second Edition brings a ton of cool classes and options to expand familiar classes like the cleric in new ways. No longer simply healers, clerics can specialize their domains but can go one step beyond in following their doctrines, expressing how they manifest their faith and their religious role! Your clerics can take on entirely new roles with the spirit-hunting Exorcist, the benevolent Faith Healer, the clever and diplomatic Majordomo, and the wandering Pilgrim!

boardgame.name: Ren's Final Flight
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A High-Level Fantasy Adventure for Player Levels 10 to 12
Intended for Use with Most Fantasy Roleplaying Games

While travelling in the mountains, you chance upon a small village preparing to celebrate the Winter Solstice. You are dismayed to learn these preparations include preparing a tribute for a dragon that dwells nearby. You learn this venerable dragon has plagued the village for centuries, demanding tributes all year round. When the villagers ask for your help in ridding them of this vile wyrm, will you answer the call this solstice?

Greetings adventurers and Game Masters!

I am very excited to release eleventh adventure in my Old School Series, REN'S LAST FLIGHT. This high-level adventure is a love letter to the gonzo, genre-bending fantasy sci-fi mashups of yore! This one-shot scenario is intended for 4 to 6 seasoned adventurers of levels 10 to 12. This adventure begins with your players being asked, as heroes often are, to free a village from the grips of a dragon. However, what the players will soon learn is that this particular dragon actually lairs in an abandoned ancient space port! So after defeating the dragon your players will be able to explore this strange complex; encounter its alien and synthetic life forms and discover all the off-world technology in its cold, dark halls. When was the last time that fighting a 350 year old dragon was only the *starting point* of your session? Buckle up, buttercup, because you're in for one wild ride, as this adventure provides 88 page of Old School excitement!

Synopsis: The adventure in this scenario takes place high in the mountains, near a small village known as Éorl’s Bane, which sits within the “no man’s land” between the forested valleys of the goodly nation of Alderburgh and the frozen steeps ruled over by the Northfolk Barbarian tribes. As Éorl’s Bane is technically outside the territorial boundaries of both of these great nations, its folk are used to the self-reliance needed to live in the wilds and on the borderlands. Indeed, these descendants of Éorl Longshanks, a spare heir of a noble lord of Alderburgh who sought to carve his own kingdom out of the wilderness, are no strangers to deprivation, for they have lived in thrall to a foul dragon, the great wyrm Steeltooth, for over three centuries. As part of a terrible bargain struck with the beast long ago, the villagers must offer up tribute four times a year, on the equinoxes and solstices. Failure to meet their obligation will result in the dragon raining fire down on the village and killing them all.

It is on such a tribute night, the Winter Solstice, when the players happen upon the village, seeking refuge whilst traveling on a dark and blustery night. Seeing their impressive gear and believing the party to be great heroes, the intended tribute Rowena Longshanks begs the players to save her and free her village from Lord Éorl’s bane, if they can! Excited by the promise of a rich dragon's hoard, and eager to do good, your group agrees to test their mettle against this great red wyrm, which goes by the name of Steeltooth!

However, your group is in for quite a surprise when you arrive at the dragon's lair! For neither the villagers nor Steeltooth are aware of a great mystery that lies within its lair, and the players are in for much more than they bargained for. This is because Steeltooth has chosen to lair on the front doorstep of a long abandoned space port built by an alien cooperative known as the Advanced Spherical Navigation Agency (ASNA). Some 400 years ago a terrible series of coincidences conspired to bring about a calamitous end to the port’s operations, and it was abandoned by its last custodian, navigator Ren Minerva. A century later the site was claimed by the young Steeltooth, but all of the wonders of this alien complex are still there, ripe for the picking!

Will you defeat the dragon, free Rowena and her village, and uncover the mystery behind Ren's Last Flight?
boardgame.rpg: Old School Reference and Index Compilation (OSRIC)

boardgame.name: Mr Lloyd's Annotated Compendium of Ingenious Victorian Devices
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Mr Lloyd presents his annotated compendium of ingenious Victorian devices. From the anti-garotting cravat, to Alexander Bell's invention of Wireless Telephony everything presented in this remarkable booklet was a genuine nineteenth century invention.

Not for this compendium wild claims based on nothing but a patent drawing that never saw light of day. From the Atmospheric Railway to Scheutz's Calculation Engine, the 52 inventions presented here were all developed and used by the inventive folk of the nineteenth century.

To those who say that the cover illustration must surely depict a work of science fiction, I say that they have never heard of Monsieur Mouchot's demonstration of a solar engine at the 1869 Paris Exhibition. Not only did he demonstrate that concentrated sunlight could power a steam engine, he used the resulting energy to run a freezer, turning the sun's rays into ice-cubes to the amazement of the visiting public.

In this compendium you will be introduced to the following Victorian inventions

Anti-Garotting Cravat
Anti-Garotting Pistol
Arithmometer
Atmospheric Railway
Automatic postman
Bicycle Railway
Boat Cloak
Bude lights
Coffin torpedo
Dactyloscopy
Easter Eggs
Electric Alarm System
Electric Belts
Electric Jewelry
Electrophone
Galvanic Bath
Gramophone
Hand-grenade Fire Extinguisher
Household Blowtorch
Ice-Cream Maker
Mechanical Beard
Medico-mechanical Gym Equipment
Monocycle
Mortsafes
Mustache Cups and Spoons
Nose Shaper
Optical Telegraph
PanTelegraph
Parenty’s automatic smoking machine
Parkesine
Pneumatic Railway
Portable Burglar Alarm
Prosthetic Limbs
Punishment Crank
Rocking Baths
Röntgen rays
Rotary hairbrush
Safety Coffins
Scheutz calculation engine
Seagoing Railway
Simms Motor Scout
Solar Panel
Solar Generator
Spotlight
Steam Gurney
Steam-powered Fire Engine
Stirling Heat Engine
Telegraphone
Watch Camera
Wire-guided Torpedo
Vidocq’s Anti-forgery Paper and Ink
Wireless Telephony
Mr Lloyd's Annotated Compendium of Ingenious Victorian Devices is annotated by three noted members of the Inferno club. Scientists from another timeline, these savants provide insightful, diverting and occasionally concerning commentary on the inventions depicted within.

boardgame.name: Battletech: Field Report 2765 – AFFS
boardgame.description:
Field Report 2765: AFFS describes the state of House Davion's Federated Suns just before the events described in Historical: Liberation of Terra (Part 1), including the overall military and logistical condition of one of the Great Houses that would eventually survive the collapse of the Star League and face a new age of endless war.

Field Report 2765: AFFS closely follows the format of Field Report: AFFS but with two new WarShip designs also included along with record sheets for each.
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: BattleTech: A Game of Armored Combat
BattleTech: A Time of War – The BattleTech RPG

boardgame.name: Butch Bruisers
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Rough and Ready!

Some soldiers are more than just trained warriors; they are simply flat-out tough! This awesome supplement brings you over a dozen new class options and alternate class features for the Riot Vox, Battle Jacket Vandal, and Rough Knuckles, including hardcore fighting abilities like call out, brawny defense, aggressive acoustics, and knuckle tats! When it's time to rumble, you'll be ready to rare and tear like nobody's business!

boardgame.name: NPCs Collection 20
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Your players' characters will run into many people during the course of a gaming session. Some will be less than memorable, and some will die at the hands of the party, or other NPCs. But some interactions call for more than a name and job title.

DRP NPC Collections feature four different character descriptions, along with their portraits. Use them as-is, flesh them out, or use just the description or the portrait. Don't be caught off guard when your players say, "We want to talk with this character!"

This system-agnostic collection includes:

Laazaan - female lizardfolk cleric
Roughwing - male hawkfolk barbarian
Reth Rix - female infernal shipwright
Woondroov - male orc bard

boardgame.name: Cackles from the Thunder Caves
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The northern waters are a fickle mistress along the shores of Castiel, the goddess Innak their only master. They can carry you to great adventure or pull you under into the darkness below. Innak’s children who tend her vast kingdom care little for mortal lives and less for their motivations. But when a captain dares to insult one by stealing a sacred item, a vengeful curse finds him and his shipmates, bringing them to ruin.

Cackles from the Thunder Caves is a Q-Crawl, or Quick-Crawl, that can be run for a group of four to six players with 5th-level characters. This crawl would be considered a ‘medium’ to ‘hard’ encounter.

boardgame.name: The Fallen Sanctum of Hrathgor
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:
The Santum of Hrathgor is a well-known holy warrior training site of Mannab near Claf-Den. Many come here to learn from the Black Badger, an elite fighter of the Lugenshod Clan. While off on a survival training mission in the Tigradad-Run Mountains with a group of trainees, the sanctum comes under attack. A crazed ‘merishuol’, a relentless predator once controlled by elven mage hunters and now spends its time looking for worthy prey, has found its next challenge.

The Fallen Sanctum of Hrathgor is a Q-Crawl, or Quick-Crawl, that can be run for a group of four to six players with 5th-level characters. This crawl would be considered a ‘medium’ to ‘hard’ encounter.

boardgame.name: Hunt of the Gliding Falcon
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Cultaar is a haven for those who seek refuge from the ruling elite in the Principalities, most having lost home and family to the controlling manors and unchecked government officials. But this is not true of all Cultaar’s residents. The well-traveled river and swaths of fertile land provide plenty of work for the abiding locals. The families under the Gliding Falcon crest have made Cultaar their home and have run a successful meadery for over a century. But a longtime feud has been rekindled in the worst way... the dead of a rival family are returning from the grave to take vengeance. Their first task, to retrieve the prized weapons of their ancestors to combat these horrors.

Hunt of the Gliding Falcon is a Q-Crawl, or Quick-Crawl, that can be run for a group of four to six players with 5th-level characters. This crawl would be considered a ‘medium’ to ‘hard’ encounter.

boardgame.name: The Tombs of the Eternal Lancers
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Several of the legendary tales out of the Greater Tres Empire period speak of a company of unrivaled lancers known as the ‘Thunder-Hoof Riders’, who fought in many battles under various banners. Their exploits are recorded in various tales and nursery rhymes that continue to be told to this day. Charge of the Unsaran, The Twelve Hills, and Ballad of Janradiir, to name a few. As with some victories, they can come at a great cost. In the Charge of Unsaran, a battle that led to the withdrawal of an invading goblin army, five champions fell.
