A tomb was constructed in secret somewhere in the Restorae Steppe with a belief that one day they will be recalled from beyond the grave if the goblin hordes were ever to return.

The Tombs of the Eternal Lancers is a Q-Crawl, or Quick-Crawl, that can be run for a group of four to six players with 5th-level characters. This crawl would be considered a ‘medium’ to ‘hard’ encounter.

boardgame.name: In Gold's Grasp
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

In the deep recesses of the underground labyrinth beneath Otrista, created from the ruins of past cities, a clever and voracious creature has made it their killing den. Just by chance, leaving the UnderRealm to explore for other food sources, it stumbled upon this savory opportunity. The few who venture into these less-traveled sections in the Grim Ward, and unlucky enough to find themselves lured in by the horde of coin, discover this to be a ‘dead’ end.

In Gold’s Grasp is a Q-Crawl, or Quick-Crawl, that can be run for a group of four to six players with 5th-level characters. This crawl would be considered a ‘medium’ to ‘hard’ encounter.

boardgame.name: The Eye of Zagoratha
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Hidden among the rocky slopes of the Volteren Mountains in southeast Dracia is a sizable grotto lost in the shadows of the crags. Beyond the unassuming entrance lies a secreted treasure of horrific power. A group of Zagoratha cultists found refuge here long ago and devised a way to safeguard it from outsiders. To discover this forgotten den of tainted malice could mean a bloody demise to any who enter.

The Eye of Zagoratha is a Q-Crawl, or Quick-Crawl, that can be run for a group of four to six players with 5th-level characters. This crawl would be considered a ‘medium’ to ‘hard’ encounter.

boardgame.name: The Third Imperium
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Third Imperium is the greatest interstellar empire in the history of Charted Space. Its Emperors have reigned for a thousand years, building a utopian society based upon the pillars of duty, honour, free trade and a powerful navy that protects its worlds and enforces its laws.

Despite all of its grand achievements, the Imperium has a dark side. It has committed genocide on its own worlds. Its leaders have assassinated and murdered each other in battle to obtain the throne. A civil war nearly tore it apart, ending the dream of its visionary first Emperor. Yet with all the Imperium has been through, it has somehow endured. The Third Imperium is at a crossroads, and choices made now will determine whether it survives or crumbles.

Into this realm enters a bold group of Travellers, seeking fame, fortune and adventure in hallowed the Core sector, the ancient centre of human civilisation, where dreams are made and broken. This book contains everything Travellers and Referees need to travel and adventure in the heart of the Third Imperium, including:


A huge poster map of the Core sector.
Detailed descriptions of the people, society, military forces and power brokers of the Third Imperium.
The complete history of the Third Imperium as it has never been told before.
The Core sector, the heart of the Imperium, including playable human and alien races and world descriptions for all 16 subsectors.
New starships, vehicles, weapons, armour and gear for use in Core sector campaigns or anywhere else in the Third Imperium.


The galaxy is rich with opportunity, nowhere more so than at the heart of the Third Imperium. Travellers need only be bold enough to claim their share of the fortune.

boardgame.name: Story Seeds Collection 15
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Sometimes you need a quick story for your players. Not a complete campaign, or even an adventure, but something you can modify to fit your table. You need a Story Seed.

DRP Story Seed Collections feature two different ideas complete enough to build a session around, yet open enough that you can add/change details, and make it your own. Use them as-is, flesh them out, or use just the description as the base of your own adventure.

This system-agnostic collection includes:

An illegal mining operation is angering the ghosts of centuries-old massacre victims
Poisonous clouds are hanging over "the glacier at the end of the world"
boardgame.rpgseries: Dark Raptor Press Story Seeds Collections

boardgame.name: Story Seeds Collection 16
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Sometimes you need a quick story for your players. Not a complete campaign, or even an adventure, but something you can modify to fit your table. You need a Story Seed.

DRP Story Seed Collections feature two different ideas complete enough to build a session around, yet open enough that you can add/change details, and make it your own. Use them as-is, flesh them out, or use just the description as the base of your own adventure.

This system-agnostic collection includes:

Bird-infested towers need to be cleaned before a summer fair can take place
A sports tournament is being held in a crooked town, and you need to keep everyone safe
boardgame.rpgseries: Dark Raptor Press Story Seeds Collections

boardgame.name: TrollsZine (Issue 11 - 2021)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The latest issue of the best T&T fanzine on the web is brought to you courtesy of Tavernmaster Games, and edited by the established team of Bill Pitcher, Dan Prentice and Sid Orpin. It features a solo mini adventure by Charles Schulz, the first level of Todd Petersen’s mega-dungeon Devil Hill, a fresh article on the divine by Dorothy McComb, Rich Burley's review of Power Trip as well as some supers for the same, Mephistopheles map, Andy Holmes' Molten Magic and a retrospective on the Sword & Sorcery show Wizards & Warriors by Jerry Nuckolls.

boardgame.name: Blood Fever
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

This is the third in TavernMaster Games' new line of solitaire and GM adventures for Tunnels & Trolls™ ; 'Dekh's Dollar Downloads'. The emphasis for these products is to maintain our high production values while achieving real value for money and giving you more roleplaying bang for your buck.

Blood Fever is a full-sized solitaire adventure for the Tunnels and TrollsTM role playing system. It has been written for all modern editions of the rules; 5th onwards . This is an expanded version of the mini-solo that appeared in Trollszine #11 with extra rooms to explore and almost 40 extra paragraphs. In addition to this, there is a GM section containing an old school map and GM notes. It is designed for characters from any of the humanoid kindreds of up to 3rd level with fewer than 25 combat adds. Magic users may enter but there are few opportunities to cast spells except for healing; Poor Baby, or for enhancing weapons prior to combat; Vorpal Blade, Unerring Blade, Whammy etc…

On your journey to the freeport of Trondhelm you have been bitten by a vampire. The physician assures you that you only have until midnight before you transform into a member of that undead race but if you can destroy the fiend who drank your blood, you could avoid that fate. With the help of a local 'vampire hunter' you are taken to the ruined tower where the vampires have made their nest. You must explore the basement and try to find their leader and kill him before the moon has risen to avoid joining their number.

boardgame.name: The Eye of the Serpent
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

This is the first in a new line of solitaire and GM adventures for Tunnels & TrollsTM from TavernMaster Games: 'Dekh's Dollar Downloads'. The emphasis for these products is to maintain our high production values while achieving real value for money and giving more roleplaying bang for your buck.

Eye of the Serpent is a short, but exciting, adventure designed for both 5th and Deluxe Editions of Tunnels & TrollsTM and is suitable for first level characters. Delvers attempting this adventure risk death within the Temple of the Timeless Serpent in the hope that they will escape with a fortune in treasure, stolen from the temple’s sinister tower....

boardgame.name: Never Trust a Wizard
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

This is the second in TavernMaster Games' new line of solitaire and GM adventures for Tunnels & TrollsTM ; 'Dekh's Dollar Downloads'. The emphasis for these products is to maintain our high production values while achieving real value for money and giving you more roleplaying bang for your buck.

Never Trust a Wizard is a mini-solitaire adventure for the Tunnels and TrollsTM role playing system.It has been written for all modern editions of the rules; 5th onwards . It is a fun little romp of a solo, though that doesn’t mean it is easy, far from it. It is appropriate for first or second level warriors or rogues with no more than 20 combat adds. All of the ‘good’ kindred can explore these 83 adventure paragraphs but note that within this eldritch realm, the ability of fairies to fly and leprechauns to teleport is negated and there is no spell casting whatsoever. It even robs humans of their ability to re-roll failed saving rolls, so no “do over” for members of that race either. Standard equipment and weapons from the rulebook can be taken through this solo but no more than 6d6 for any weapon or armour protection of more than 8 hits in total.

It had all sounded so easy when the wizard Runcion had approached you. Break into the mage's tower when she is away and help yourselves to enough treasure and arcane artefacts to keep you in food and ale for the next ten years. But alas, your plans have come to nothing. You have been captured and to entertain your host must escape the tower basement....

boardgame.name: The Chocolate Orange Mystery
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Oblige your Tunnels & TrollsTM players to engage in daft activities for a few hours, in the name of festive fun. Any kindred, class and level of character can make a merry fool of themselves in this silly adventure - and SAVE CHRISTMAS!!

It's Christmas Eve, and Elma the Christmas Elf urgently needs a team of bold adventurers to solve a complex mystery in Santa's workshops at the North Pole. If it doesn't get sorted out, maybe Christmas won't happen at all!

This GM adventure is suitable for all editions of Tunnels & TrollsTM and probably, with minimal conversion, all editions of any fantasy role-playing game!

boardgame.name: Battletech: Field Report 2765 – CCAF
boardgame.description:
2765 Field Report: CCAF describes the state of House Liao's Capellan Confederation just before the events described in Historical: Liberation of Terra (Part 1), including the overall military and logistical condition of one of the Great Houses that would eventually survive the collapse of the Star League and face a new age of endless war.

Field Report 2765: CCAF closely follows the format of Field Report: CCAF but with two new WarShip designs also included along with record sheets for each.
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: BattleTech: A Game of Armored Combat
BattleTech: A Time of War – The BattleTech RPG

boardgame.name: Dollars Wanted
boardgame.description:
In Dollars Wanted, you and your fellow crooks work together to crack safes...sort of.

You place crowbars, dynamite, revolvers, and other tools in rows of face-down cards in front of buildings, and if you manage to crack the safe at just the right time, you'll scoot away with a lot of dollars. Grab too early and hesitate too long, however, you'll wind up with nothing for your effort.

listing.notes:
first Edition, German version, © 2022 by Huch & Friends
rules including in German and in English, French
Shipping costs see informations below.
Payment via PayPal or bank transfer. If you pay via PayPal, please use the button “Send to friends abroad”, then there are no fees. ... Thanks!!

boardgame.name: Battletech: Field Report 2765 – DCMS
boardgame.description:
Field Report 2765: DCMS describes the state of House Kurita's Draconis Combine just before the events described in Historical: Liberation of Terra (Part 1), including the overall military and logistical condition of one of the Great Houses that would eventually survive the collapse of the Star League and face a new age of endless war.

Field Report 2765: DCMS closely follows the format of Field Report: DCMS, but with two new WarShip designs with the respective record sheets.
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: BattleTech: A Game of Armored Combat
BattleTech: A Time of War – The BattleTech RPG

boardgame.name: Mind on the Movies
boardgame.description:
Mind on the Movies is about creating movie titles and letting your friends pitch the ideas. You are either the writer that must create the movie idea using word cards or you become the producer giving the thumbs up or down for movie ideas. It has more customization and imagination than any popular voting game, but still very easy to pick up.

All One80 Games proceeds go to Campus One80 Ministries, a Christian leadership and outreach mission that serves the colleges of the US.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Vatikan
boardgame.description: It's an abstract game similiar to Round Chess. The game is played in turns on a Circular board with one player playing as red and the other as green. Players move their pieces between spaces according to the rules of the piece being moved. There are seven different pieces. The goal is to be the first player to bring your Cardinal to Vatikan (center of the board) through the opponents half or to remove the opponents Cardinal.

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

boardgame.name: Planszówkowi Kurierzy
boardgame.description:
Kids are waiting for board game elements. Will you help deliver them to their homes? Dice by trains, pawns by truck or maybe cards by ship? You decide what to load on the available vehicles. The person who does it most efficiently will be the winner.

The game combines fun with the development of a child's math skills: it teaches counting up to 20, orders of magnitude and simple fractions. The players' task is to fill their vehicles with game elements and deliver them to homes from all over the world.

boardgame.name: Unencumbered
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Unencumbered is a homebrew system for 5th Edition that simplifies inventory management and allows you to sort and loot items quickly and easily!

The system can resolve adding items without having to identify their individual weights and calculating the total weight cost, which can often slow down gameplay due to the extra work.

It focuses on the player's skills which allows space for roleplay opportunities as well as interesting gameplay effects. It removes the limit of being encumbered and rather adds an interesting twist if one decides to carry more than they can!

It's used to record legacy information on house screens, stickers, cards, and the oversized map.

boardgame.name: Plantagenet: Cousins' War for England, 1459 - 1485
boardgame.description:
In Plantagenet—the newest volume in Volko Ruhnke's Levy & Campaign Series—players lead one of the two factions across the three main periods of war, as individual scenarios or the entire Wars of the Roses.

Designer Francisco Gradaille adds overall and local political influence to Volko’s medieval operation system to reflect the ever-changing loyalties of the time while keeping play familiar to fans of the Series. Players will create and maintain a network of allied lords and nobles in order to obtain the provender and coin needed to supply and pay their armies. As ravaging and looting will damage each side’s reputation, each faction will strive to convince cites to join its side. Great battles will seek to kill or capture enemy lords—perhaps even a king. Two kinds of operational moves will be in play: the military and the political.

In the end, when the dust settles and all arrows have flown, one rose will sit on the throne. White or Red, York or Lancaster, gather your troops and banners and join the fight.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Cyberpunk 2077: Gangs of Night City
boardgame.description:
Cyberpunk 2077: Gangs of Night City is a big box strategy game with miniatures in which gangs fight for control of a city, with the city also being a living part of the game.

In the game, players assume the role of a gang leader, with you organizing your gang members to take power in the city. Your actions affect not only your game and your opponents but the city itself. Each gang has different attributes and goals, giving each player a different gaming experience.

boardgame.name: The Last Tank R&W Version
boardgame.description:
The Last Tank is a solo game simulating tank combat in the period of the invasion of the German army on the Moscow front in 1941.

Objective: The tank must survive until the end of the tenth turn. When it is destroyed, the game will be over.

To overcome the enemies you need your ingenuity as the captain of the tank, you will make decisions that are put into practice on the battlefield, this is achieved by defending your position and destroying all enemies, using both the cannon and the submachine guns. your tank.
—description from the designer

boardgame.name: The Nutty Squirrel
boardgame.description: You play as a squirrel and collect as many nuts as you can. Watch out, there are cars to hit you that make you lose your nuts. Plus, you can steal nuts, roll the dice and get more nuts, also skip players. The goal is to get a total of 60 nuts before anybody else.

boardgame.name: Algo que empieza por...
Etwas, das anfängt mit...
Qualcosa che inizia con...
Quelque Chose Commençant par…
Something Beginning With...
boardgame.description:
It is an word game in a little mint tin box with an D20 letter dice and 50 sheets of paper with questions. It's simple to play and fits in every Pocket.
Short Shuffle all papers, lay it to the "?"-site. At your turn,flip the top card and role the dice. If you find the correct answer, get the card as Point. Then is the next player turn. The player with the most points wins.

Questions in all editions are in 5 languages. The mint tin case and rules are language specific.

boardgame.description: Rude and crude expansion pack for Gobby. Contains 50 phrase start and finish cards giving you 2500 new possible phrase combinations bringing the total up to 10,000 when added to the base game.

boardgame.name: Torneo!
boardgame.description:
Two knights challenge each other in a tournament. A bidding system allow to win each turn. Winning two turns in a row means that the opponent is unsaddled: a knight on saddle has bonus on his bets against an unsaddled one. The player winning three turns more than the opponent wins the game.

—description from the designer

Published on History Kids, italian edition, issue #10.

boardgame.name: Futmes
boardgame.description:
FUTMES is The Most Ruthless Fútbol Board Game Ever. In this game you can live the experience of a soccer match full of unexpected events.

Your team will consist of one Coach, one Captain, three Football Players and one Stadium where you will play your home matches.
Use your cards and your strategic skills to defeat other teams and win the FUTMES LEAGUE.
Always pay attention to the skills of your team members, they could be the difference between a win and a defeat

In FUTMES the resources are called EVENT CARDS and are useful for controlling the unexpected events of the game.

Anything can happen during a FUTMES match flipping the CHANCE CARDS and find out if your goal was successful.

boardgame.name: Merriweather Wetlands Park
boardgame.description:
From itch.io:

Welcome to Merriweather.

“Merriweather Wetlands Park is home to an abundance of life. This nature reserve is a protected ecosystem and home to all sorts of native flora and fauna. This massive wetlands is accessible via a beautiful, weatherproof boardwalk. Come explore nature’s paradise at the Merriweather Wetlands Boardwalk.”

While the giants roamed this land, this park was a great escape for those looking to get out into nature. Now, this park is the Inland Kingdom of the Aves. Ruled over by a benevolent council of birds, this land is bountiful and teaming with activity. The frogs run the trade, the squirrels man the security. Wise toads and mystical nutrias guard hidden knowledge. Most of this land is only navigable by air or the Boardwalk Causeway, for those who venture to small, isolated islands; adventure is there to be had. Watch out for the lone coyote.

What is in the Pamphlet?

Merriweather Wetlands Park is a Mausritter adventure location that is based on real world wetland nature parks and boardwalks. This pamphlet presents a fleshed out region full of NPCs and many encounters.

Inside this Mausritter adventure location is:

A large adventure site
Political intrigue
5 Factions, all with goals and resources
A new Creature
Reference to many Third-Party Products
9 Locations
2d6 Boardwalk Events

boardgame.name: WISP
boardgame.description:
WISP is the new trick-taking card game that is recognisably different from some established trick-taking games. The core differences include the following aspects:


You can compete as a team or individually.
There are no "normal" cards that are hierarchically equal. So you can get into trick-taking incredibly quickly.
It will always be dealt the same number of cards.
The announcement of a trick to be taken is an inferior element, which exists only in the team variant.


Welcome to the world of mythical creatures and have fun dueling!

boardgame.name: 8 Particular Arrows
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Check out the collection of 8 new and interesting arrows for the most popular role-playing game in the world!

boardgame.name: Flying tomb of Abbot
Latający grobowiec Abbota
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

City of Kalaltin is struggling because of unexplained disease. One of the local shamans believes that a forgotten hero is responsible. According to him, a magical object located in the tomb of said hero might be the cause of the problem. The shaman is certain, that the object is guarded by creatures inhabiting these forgotten halls. Players will have to get to the temple located on a flying island, face the forgotten hero, as well as a group of undead berserk elves who are worshipping him, the followers of the War Cult.

Abbot's Flying Tomb is an adventure prepared for 4 players of levels 3-4. It is a one-shot adventure that should last for about 3-5 hours of gameplay.

In addition to the description of the adventure, you will also find:

- a new playable race
- 5 new enemies
- 2 mercenaries that can be hired by your team
- new magic item
- an open end that can be used as the beginning of a campaign


Miasto Kalaltin, które zmaga się z niewyjaśnioną chorobą potrzebuje waszej pomocy. Jeden z lokalnych szamanów uważa, że za chorobą stoi jeden z zapomnianych bohaterów. Uważa on że rozwiązaniem tego problemu jest magiczny obiekt, który znajduje się w grobowcu tego bohatera. Jest on jednak pewien, że obiekt ten jest strzeżony przez istoty zamieszkujące te starożytne ruiny. Gracze muszą dostać do grobowca znajdującej się na latającej wyspie i stawić czoła nieumarłemu bohaterowi i grupie wielbiących go nieumarłych elfów berserków, wyznawców kultu wojny.

Latający grobowiec Abbota jest przygodą przygotowaną dla 4 graczy 3-4 poziomu. Jest to przygoda typu one shot która powinna starczyć na około 3-5h gry.

Poza opisem przygody znajdziesz tu także:
- nową grywalną rase
- 5 noych przeciwników
- 2 najemników, których może wynająć twoja dróżyna
- nowy magiczny przedmiot
- otwarte zakończenie które może zostać wykorzystane jako początek kampanii

boardgame.name: Księga losowych: 50 tabel - Różności
Midnight Owl's book of random 50 Tables: Miscellaneous
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

This book contains a compilation of 50 random tables of different complexity and length for your world-building needs. Miscellaneous items, states, and events are theme of this compilation. Things that usually don't work with each other thematically but are handy to have them in one book. In this compilation, you can find such tables as fruits, addictions, tools, minerals, card games, phobias, crimes and more.


Ta książka zawiera kompilację 50 losowych tabel o różnej złożoności i długości na potrzeby budowy twojego wałasnego fantastycznego świata. Tematem przewodnim są różności.
Rzeczy, które zwykle nie współpracują ze sobą tematycznie, ale warto je mieć zebrane w jednym miejscu. W tej kompilacji znajdziesz takie tabele jak: owoce, nałogi, narzędzia, minerały, gry karciane, fobie, przestępstwa i inne.

boardgame.name: Księga losowych 2: 100 losowych segmentów lochu
Midnight Owl's book of random 2: 100 Random dungeon segments
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

This book is a collection of 100 dungeon segments that you can drop into your own growing dungeon. This book does not contain information about random encounters, traps, or treasures. Just the size and look of the rooms that your players can explore. Great tool for any sandbox campaign or solo dungeon crawl. All you need is a d100 and a sheet of graph paper.


Ta książka jest zbiorem 100 segmentów lochów, które możesz wrzucić do własnego rosnącego lochu. Ta książka nie zawiera informacji o przypadkowych spotkaniach, pułapkach czy skarbach.
Tylko rozmiar i wygląd pomieszczeń, które mogą eksplorować Twoi gracze. Świetne narzędzie do każdej sandboxowej kampanii lub solo ekspedycji.
Wszystko czego potrzebujesz to k100 i kartka papieru w kratke.

boardgame.name: Fortress of the Amethyst Hills
Grobowiec Bogów 1: Forteca Ametystowych Wzgórz
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Fortress of the Amethyst Hills is the first of many parts of the Tomb of the Gods dungeon.

The package includes two maps of the dungeon, a map of the local area and a map of the city of Hatersten.


Forteca Ametystowych Wzgórz to pierwsza z wielu części lochu Grobowiec Bogów.

W paczce znajdują się dwie mapy lochu, mapa okolicy oraz mapa miasta Hatersten.
boardgame.rpgitemversion: Fortress of the Amethyst Hills PDF

boardgame.name: Amethyst Alley
Grobowiec Bogów 2: Ametystowy zaułek
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Amethyst Alley is a continuation of the adventure Fortress of the Amethyst Hills. Gather your team and help the mayor of Hatersten. The tunnels under the Tomb of the Gods still has many secrets.

The package includes two maps of the dungeon, three maps for random battles included in the adventure, three handout that you can give to your players during the game, a map of the area and a map of the city of Hatersten.


Ametystowy zaułek to kontynuacja przygody Forteca Ametystowych Wzgórz. Zbierzcie drużynę i pomóżcie burmistrzowi miasta Hatersten. Podziemia pod Grobowcem Bogów nadal kryją sobie wiele tajemnic.

W paczce znajdują się dwie mapy lochu, trzy mapy losowych walk uwzględnionych w przygodzie, trzy dodatki które możesz podczas gry przekazać swoim graczom, mapa okolicy oraz mapa miasta Haterste

boardgame.name: Grobowiec Bogów 3: Wąwóz czaszki
Skull Gorge
Tomb of the Gods 2: Skull Gorge
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Skull Gorge is a continuation of the Tomb of the Gods dungeon. This adventure has been prepared for four level 3-4 players. Gather your party and continue your journey deep into the dark tunnels under the Tomb of the Gods. Bloodthirsty beasts and potential allies await you within these forgotten ruins.

The pack contains three maps of the dungeon, three maps of random battles included in the adventure, a map of the area, and a map of the city of Hatersten.


Wąwóz czaszki to kontynuacja lochu Grobowiec Bogów. Przygoda ta została przygotowana dla czterech graczy poziomu 3-4. Zbierzcie drużynę i kontynuujcie swą podróż, wgłąb mrocznych tuneli pod Grobowcem Bogów. Krwiożercze bestie i potencjalni sojusznicy czekają na was wewnątrz tych zapomnianych ruin.

W paczce znajdują się trzy mapy lochu, trzy mapy losowych walk uwzględnionych w przygodzie, mapa okolicy oraz mapa miasta Hatersten.

boardgame.name: Frogmen Village
Grobowiec Bogów 4: Wioska żaboludów
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Frogmen Village is a continuation of the Tomb of the Gods dungeon. This adventure has been prepared for four level 3-4 players. Goblin Captain Zrogned needs your help. Frogmen, living in the area, regularly attack and kidnaps his subordinates. Gather your party and continue your journey deep into the dark tunnels under the Tomb of the Gods. Investigate the secrets of the Frog Village and discover what they need so many captives for.

The package includes two maps of the dungeon, a map of the area and a map of the city of Hatersten.


Wioska żaboludów to kontynuacja lochu Grobowiec Bogów. Przygoda ta została przygotowana dla czterech graczy poziomu 3-4. Gobliński kapitan Zrogned potrzebuje waszej pomocy. Mieszkające w okolicy żaboludy regularnie napadają i porywają jego podwładnych. Zbierzcie drużynę i kontynuujcie swą podróż, wgłąb mrocznych tuneli pod Grobowcem Bogów. Zbadajcie tajemnice żabiej wioski i odkrycie, po co im tylu jeńców.

W paczce znajdują się dwie mapy lochu, mapa okolicy oraz mapa miasta Hatersten.

boardgame.name: Grobowiec Bogów 5: Leże błękitnego gada
Lair of blue reptile.
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Lair of blue reptile is a continuation of the Tomb of the Gods dungeon. This adventure has been prepared for four level 4-5 players. Gather your party and continue your journey deep into the dark tunnels under the Tomb of the Gods.

The pack contains two maps of the dungeon, a map of the area, and a map of the city of Hatersten.


Leże błękitnego gada to kontynuacja lochu Grobowiec Bogów. Przygoda ta została przygotowana dla czterech graczy poziomu 4-5. Po tym jak twoi bohaterowie pomogli kapitanowi Zrognedowi w pozbyciu się problemu w wiosce żaboludów, gobliny chcą poprosić o jeszcze jedną przysługę. W południowej części Wąwozu Czaszki swój obóz rozbiła spora grupa myśliwych grimloków. Atakują niemal każdego, kto wejdzie im w drogę. Zabierają zwłoki swoich ofiar do swego plugawego leża. Kapitan chce się ich pozbyć za wszelką cenę. Zbadajcie, komu mogą służyć te plugawe bestie.

Field Report 2765: FWLM describes the state of House Marik's Free Worlds League just before the events described in Historical: Liberation of Terra (Part 1), including the overall military and logistical condition of one of the Great Houses that would eventually survive the collapse of the Star League and face a new age of endless war.

Field Report 2765: FWLM closely follows the format of Field Report: FWLM but with one new WarShip design also included along with record sheets for each of its variants.

Field Report 2765: LCAF closely follows the format of Field Report: LAAF but with one new WarShip design also included along with record sheets for each of its variants.

BattleTech: A Time of War – The BattleTech RPG

boardgame.name: Tusky Joe's Snorkel Adventure
boardgame.description:
Tusky Joe's Snorkel Adventure is a 2-4 player light-medium family-friendly game about diving for treasures in the sea. The game features a nice blend of dice rolling, engine building and push your luck.

Over 7 rounds, players will be heading out on Tusky Joe's boat, strapping on their snorkels and diving gear and looking for lost treasures in the sea. On your turn, roll your dice and assign them to salvage cards that you'd like to recover. Beautiful treasures are there to be found and worth lots of delicious points. Don't like what you see? Move through the water using the brilliant side-scrolling sea bed.

Trade in your salvage at the shop to buy new gear which will help you in the water to achieve better dice results. Choose your strategy and tailor your equipment. Gain the most points by the end of the game and you're the winner!

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Battletech: Record Sheets – Vehicle Annex: IndustrialMechs & Exoskeletons
boardgame.description: BattleTech Record Sheets: Vehicle Annex, IndustrialMechs & Exoskeletons offers players the record sheets for all the IndustiralMechs and Exoskeletons detailed in BattleTech Technical Readout: Vehicle Annex, over 90 in total, many variants making their debut here.
boardgame.boardgameaccessory: BattleTech: A Game of Armored Combat

boardgame.name: Trivial Pursuit: Decades – 2010 to 2020
Trivial Pursuit: Edition 2010-2020
boardgame.description:
Put all that streaming, scrolling, and sharing to the test with questions about bingeworthy shows, chart-topping hits, major headlines, hilarious memes, and more from 2010 to 2020. Think you’re the GOAT when it comes to 2010s pop culture quiz games? Here's your chance to prove it!

The Trivial Pursuit Decades 2010 to 2020 board game features pop culture trivia questions from 6 categories, including Playlist, Bingeworthy, Culture, News Alert, Break the Internet, and Game On. Gather friends and family members for a fun night of trivia. Leave out the gameboard and play using cards only! The Trivial Pursuit Decades 2010 to 2020 game cards come in a convenient box to take on the go.

boardgame.name: ROAARR Challenge
boardgame.description: To be the best at Roaarr Challenge, you will have to speak up and make sure you’re the first to be heard! Budding impressionists will need to fine-tune their best animal calls to win! This hilarious game for children from 4 years old is a game of speed where observation skills and concentration are key to success. Each player takes on the role of an animal: they can only express themselves through their cries. The aim of the game? Win the most cards by being the fastest to scream out whenever 2 identical cards appear on the table! Things are about to get loud!

boardgame.name: TKG ARENA: A Rift of Portals
boardgame.description:
Establishing a portal to another world is a major milestone by any yardstick. The Constellars are often tasked with the conveyance of armies across realms during wars and this ability is crucial to their role.

Setting up and preparing for the ritual is the easy part, the real challenge comes in maintaining a delicate balance of the cosmic forces as one disrupts the fabric of space and time so that others may arrive at their intended destination safely.

TKG ARENA: A Rift of Portals is a game for 1 player.

Components required for this game:

WORLD TILES: 48
OINKS: 15 from each element for each player (Default)

Winning Conditions

The objective of the game is to stabilize the portal once it is set up and this is represented by fulfilling a number of conditions.

1. The number of Oinks in the Inner Gate must be equal or more than the Oinks placed in the Outer Void.
2. The number of elemental insignias placed on any linear sides of the Boundary must be equal.
3. The elemental insignias on each tile must be matched by a placed Oink representing the same element.

Ending Condition

The game ends when all tiles are played and all unmatched Oinks on any tile on the Boundary are moved to the Outer Void. The player loses when the winning conditions are not achieved when the game ends.

Setup

A player starts the game by drawing randomly from a stack of world tiles to be placed in a 3 x 3 grid manner as below.

X A B C O
D I E
F G H

1. Shuffle the 48 world tiles into a stack. World tiles are referred to as tiles.

2. Draw 3 tiles from the stack. From these 3 tiles, flip 1 over to the grid side to form the Outer Void (This is represented by the faced down tile O in the diagram), 1 to form the Inner Gate (This is represented by the faced down tile I in the diagram).

3. Gain the Oinks matched by the elemental insignias of the last remaining tile and discard it, an area such as X can be designated for discarded tiles in the diagram.

All world tiles built are placed faced up with their elemental insignias visible. Tiles A, B, C, D, E, F, G, H surrounding tile I forms the Boundary. To fulfill winning condition 2, the sum of the number of elemental insignias on the Tiles A, B, C; Tiles C,E, H; Tiles F,G, H and Tiles A, D, F are equal.

On each turn

Draw 3 tiles from the stack and the player must perform ONE of each of the following actions in the following order:

1. Gain - Play a tile, gain the Oinks indicated on the elemental insignias and discard it. Put the Oinks gained in the Inner Gate.

2. Build - Build a tile, if it is the first tile, place it adjacent to the Inner Gate, if it is not, it must be placed adjacent to another tile that has been built that bears at least one of its own elemental insignias. If the intended location is adjacent to two or more world tiles, then all adjacent world tiles must bear at least one matching elemental insignia between them.

If you are unable to or do not wish to build for any reason, gain the Oinks indicated on any one of the remaining tiles that has not been played and put them into the Outer Void. You can also replace any tile built with any tile in your hand but all Oinks placed on the built tile will be placed in the Outer Void.

3. Move - Play a tile, you can move Oinks indicated on the elemental insignias of this tile from the Inner Gate to any built tile, or to move any Oink from a built tile to an adjacent built tile. If you are unable to or do not wish to move any of the Oinks indicated for any reason, gain the Oinks instead and put them into the Outer Void.

The player cannot skip any action and each action must be fulfilled in totality. E.g. During a Move action, a tile with 3 Fire Insignias has been chosen but the player has only 1 Fire Oink in the Inner Gate. You may NOT move the existing 1 Fire Oink to any other tile, gain 2 Fire Oinks and then placed them in the Outer Void. 3 Fire Oinks should be gained and placed in the Outer Void.

Scoring

For each Oink placed in a tile that bears the same insignia, gain 1 Victory Point. The player with the most Victory Points wins the final victory if multiple players are competing. Ties are broken by the difference in Oinks between their Outer Void and Inner Gate. The player with the greater difference wins. If the differences are the same, the players shared a joint victory.

Variant

The game can be scaled up with a BOUNDARY with sides featuring more tiles. (E.g 4 or 5). The rest of the rules remain unchanged. In this case, players can choose to leave the space representing the Inner Gate empty instead of a faced down tile I. Players can choose to use other appropriate counters to represent Oinks during play.

boardgame.name: Trolling for Trouble: Wallet
boardgame.description: Wallet for Trolling for Trouble, included in the December 2020 Board Game of the Month Club $5+ package.

boardgame.name: Neimhaim
boardgame.description:
Neimhaim is a 1 to 7 player cooperative game based on the popular saga of Nordic fantasy novels by Aranzazu Serrano Lorenzo. Players control brave heroes who must unite the peoples of the Forbidden Peninsula - the brave Kranyal warriors and the peaceful Djendel priests - before winter falls upon them. The games have an average duration of 45 minutes.

The objective of the game is to drive out the invaders and restore the Alliance in all villages. If you succeed... congratulations! You have all won!

Neimhaim is a fantasy literature saga with a Nordic setting, an epic saga enriched with the force of Viking myths and the mystery of Celtic culture. A unique and original universe endowed with an extensive ‘world building’ that includes illustrations, original designs and maps. Recommended for youth and adult audiences.

boardgame.name: Carcassonne: Die Wegweiser
Carcassonne: The Signposts
boardgame.description:
Carcassonne: The Signposts is a 12-tile expansion that can be mixed with the Carcassonne base game.

Each tile features, among other things, one or more road segments and two of three possible signposts, with the signposts indicating a left turn, a right turn, or a straight path. When a road that contains a signpost is scored, for each signpost you look at the next tile adjacent to the signpost, and if the road segment on that tile matches the signpost, then the signpost scores. For example, if the signpost shows a right turn, and the adjacent tile features a right turn (regardless of any other road segments), then the signpost scores.

If you score only one type of signpost, then each such signpost is worth 1 point; if you score two types, then they're each worth 2 points; and if you score three types, they're each worth 1 billion, I mean, 3 points.

At game's end, each signpost pointing in the correct direction on an unfinished road is worth 1 point.

boardgame.name: King of 12: Turnierspiel Promo
boardgame.description:
King of 12 - Tournament Promo
King of 12 - Turnierspiel Promo
It is possible to play with up to 16 players.
Multiple games are needed.
You play in different groups like you do in a normal game. Each winner within his or her group will the compete with the winner of the other group.

boardgame.name: Bum Simulator
boardgame.description:
You live on the streets of Bumsville. Do you have what it takes to adapt, survive and become an urban legend?

Apart from day-to-day survival, you can enjoy many unique activities:


Weaponize the pigeons
Learn the secrets of Alcohol Alchemy
Build your own cardboard house
Talk with your shopping cart friend
Solve the mystery of sewer rat people
...and much more!

boardgame.name: Civilia
boardgame.description:
In Civilia, players place down overlapping cards to make groups of symbols and expand their civilization. The player that builds the largest group of a symbol becomes World Leader in that sector.

Exploit your superiority by planning and achieving to score points before your opponents take back the advantage! Score final points after the last card is drawn and the player with the most points wins.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Z_v35CSWckA

boardgame.name: Amazons Vs Valkyries: Barbarian Paths
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Daughters of Ares and the Daughters of Odin…

A Mythic World of Chaos and War…

This file covers the most common barbarian paths in the Amazons vs Valkyries adventure setting.

Features:

The Beast Rider. Form a spiritual bond with your mount, whether it is a horse, bear, griffon, or some other creature!

The Mighty Heroine. Crush your enemies with overpowering strength!

The True Berserker. Shapechange into a were-creature when you rage, but warn your allies to keep a safe distance!

If you're playing an Amazons vs Valkyries campaign, these paths are essential. If you're playing another Norse or Greek themed setting, definitely check this out! And if your campaign doesn't have barbaric beast riders, brawny champions, and bloodthirsty shapechangers, it should!

boardgame.name: Experimental Combat Rules for Lightning League
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Bullets will stop them!

This book is a supplement to Lightning League, the game of pulp science fiction and horror. Lightning League recreates the horror of early Atomic Age movies and comic books. While many threats are immune to conventional harm, a lot aren't. This book expands on combat, providing options rules for ranged and melee attacks, a streamined damage system, options for initiative and a system for using endurance for truly heroic feats.

boardgame.name: Threees!
boardgame.description:
Threees! is an abstract game with 81 tiles. There are 3 sets of 27 tiles. Each tile in a set has one of 3 different shapes, 3 different colours and 3 different quantities (number of shapes). The tiles are played directly on to a flat surface or table. There is an initial setup round to find the starting player and place some starting tiles on the table. No player scores in this setup round. All players then takes 3 tiles at random from the draw pile (or bag).

On their turn a player can either play their tiles or exchange them. To play, strategically place 1-3 tiles in a line adjacent to tiles already on the table, so making and/or extending line(s) with the existing tiles. The maximum number of tiles that can be in a line is 9.

Score 1 point for every tile in each line made or extended, so if a tile is in two lines it is counted twice. If the player has placed all 3 tiles, they receive a bonus of 3 points. The player then replenishes their hand up to three tiles. If the player had placed the ninth and last tile in a line (a "Niner") they get an extra go. If the player goes out (no tiles remaining in hand or in the draw pile), then they get a bonus of 3 points, play continues until every tile has been played.

The game ends when the draw pile is empty and every player has played all their tiles. The player with the highest score wins.

boardgame.name: C*NT: The Outrageous Four Letter Word Game
Cunt
boardgame.description:
C*NT is a four letter swear word dice game where the last player out is the C*NT! There are 4 lettered dice, each die has a wild card '*' on it. The included swear list score pad has 4 columns of 10 offensive four letter words, one column for each player. The words further down the list are more difficult to throw (statistically), C*NT at the bottom, being the hardest to throw.

In turns, each player bids to get control of the dice or passes. A bid consists of a number of throws and a swear word from the swear list. Each subsequent bid must be a fewer number of throws and/or a harder word to throw than the previous bid. When everyone else passes the last bidder wins control of the dice, they are now the Tosser.

The Tosser takes the dice and tries to throw the bid swear word within the stated number of tosses. If the word is thrown then the Tosser can cross off that word (or the first remaining word above it) from their swear list. If they have crossed off all their words, they go out, otherwise they start the next bidding round. If they did not throw their swear word, all the other players cross off their highest remaining swear word above and including the bid word, then the player to the left starts the next bidding round.

If at any time four asterisks are thrown then all the other player go out immediately. The last player "out" is a C*NT, everyone points at the C*NT and shouts "C*NT". The C*NT buys the next round of drinks, etc.

boardgame.name: Tabletop Gaming - The Best Games of 2021
boardgame.description:
Tabletop Gaming

The Best Games of 2021
boardgame.rpg: Doctor Who: The Roleplaying Game Second Edition

boardgame.name: Ascet
boardgame.description:
Ascet is a minimalist playing card game with roleplaying overtones that encourages diplomatic, mnemonic and maths skills with the use of simple mechanics that use cards, a d8 and a d10 dice (included in the deck as a card to cut, fold & paste). Inspired in the popular medieval theme of the ascetic monk that withdrew from society in search for enlightenment which has caught the imagination of master painters like Hieronymus Bosch, Salvador Dali, Albrecht Dürer, Max Ernst and Cezanne to name a few. Players will take turns to interpret an anchorite while the rest of the players take the role of demons seeking to lure him with
Gameplay:

Each player will have 4 virtues: Compassion, Humility, Faith and Temperance. The Virtues have numerical values between 1 and 10. Additionally, players have in their hand temptation cards corresponding to the 4 virtues.

Players take turns playing their Ascet while the rest play the demons. Each demon presents a temptation card to the Ascet, and the Ascet chooses one of the presented temptations to overcome. They roll an 8 sided die for minor temptations and a 10 sided die for major temptations. If the result is equal or lower than the corresponding virtue, the Ascet overcomes the temptation and ascends one step in the Stairway to Enlightenment. Otherwise, the demon who proposed the temptation receives an additional card. Afterwards, all demons receive one card, regardless of success or failure.

if the roll was a 9, regardless of success or failure, the Ascet gets a Revalation, which may allow them to increase one of the virtues by 1.

The first player to ascend 5 steps on the Stairway to Enlightenment wins.

boardgame.name: Astro Knights
boardgame.description:
Astro Knights is a cooperative deck building game where your deck is never shuffled. Your goal is to defeat the Boss before it destroys your team or the Homeworld you’re defending.

Each round, the players and the Boss will take turns in a random order. During a player’s turn, they will be able to acquire Fuel, Tech, and Weapons from the supply, equip and attack with those Weapons based on the number of slots they have, gain new slots, power up, and use their special ability. All four of the Bosses in this game have their own decks and abilities, and will require a different strategy to be defeated
boardgame.boardgamepodcastepisode: Cardboard Time Episode 32: Astro Knights, a Discussion on Accessibility and Colorblindness in Gaming With Brian Chandler of Colorblindgames.com, and More!

boardgame.name: Push n Push
boardgame.description:
Push n Push is an abstract board game that combines elements of strategy and push-your-luck where players push each other's pawns to get rid of other players' pawns by pushing them out of the game board area.

The game is played in a way where players can move their pawns a distance from the tile that is determined from the number of dice they have rolled, player pieces can only move in a straight line (forward or backward) according to the direction of the arrow on their pawn (unless their pawns are pushed by another pawn). the player can push the opponent's pawn out of the game board area, the direction of the arrow of the pawn being pushed does not have to be the same as the pawn pushing it, a pawn can push more than one pawn. Players cannot push their own pawns out of the game board area.

The goal of the game is to push 9 (2 players) or 6 (4 players) opponent pawns off the game board area.

boardgame.name: Detecteam Family: Cheating Champions
Detecteam Family: Triche à la course
Детектим для семьи: Гонка неЧемпионов
boardgame.description:
Today the forest inhabitants hold a sports festival! The crowd is greaeting the athletes. Ready, Steady, Go! But what's the news: the competition is not that fair. Try on the role of detective! Find out who was the only true winner of the race. To know all the details, you'll have to discuss the story with all the animals in the game. After the game you are going to answer a few questions and find out what really happened. Play as a team, discuss the story, and get to the bottom of it!

This is a cooperative detective board game for the whole family. You will literally piece together the event (connect several cards to get the full picture) and attempt to get it right. After the game you are going to answer a few questions and find out what really happened. Play as a team, discuss the story, and get to the bottom of it!

The players lay cards in a 3x4 grid out on the table. New cards must be connected to the starting cards like a jigsaw puzzle so that in the end there's a complete picture on the table. The game begins with 2 starting cards placed in the center of the table. Then there is a deck with all the other cards. Players need to lay out the 4 top cards next to the deck pics down.

On their turns, they need to pick 2 out of 5 cards (1 top from the deck and 4 next to it). Look at them and decide, whether the info on the cards is useful or not. If it is useful, they connect these to the starting ones. If not, discarded. Then it's the nest turn, and so on.
Players need to discuss the cards to decide

When the story has come to an end, there should be a complete picture of cards. Players need to discuss the plot to decide on the cards to lay out or discard. After that players should answer 6 questions about the event. Who did that, why, etc. Check their answers with the finishing cards. The team wins when they managed to answer all 6 questions correctly AND laid out the cards with the correct details in the puzzle.

boardgame.name: Crypto Card Game: NFT
boardgame.description:
In the Crypto Card Game - NFT, we play the role of collectors of digital works of art and pictures from famous collections who are looking for the interesting NFTs for themselves to buy.

The place of competition for players in the game is the NTFs market and the players' task during the game is to buy this type of tokens from other players. The game is played according to the following rules.

All players reveal their own card at the same time and look for the same symbols and pictures on the cards with the rest of the players. The player who finds an identical picture on one of his opponents calls it loudly and takes its card back to his pile of cards.
Each picture on the game cards is original and represented in the real and virtual world of the NFT. To begin with, each player should recognize and correctly name all NFTs in the game. During the game, the names of the pictures can be given in full or shortened names.

The game ends as soon as one player collects all his opponents' cards and becomes the winner.

boardgame.name: Moc Słowa biblijna gra planszowa
boardgame.description:
The Power of the Word is a board game where you can learn stories about the Lord Jesus and spend a great time with your family or friends.

The game is introduced by a story about people who are looking for treasures. They found the chest with fragments of priceless woven paintings depicting scenes from the Gospel. Now the treasure is in the hands of the players. They have beautiful, multi-colored cards with scenes from the Gospel in front of them, as well as pictures and words from the Bible.

On their turn, they decide which dice to roll and which cards to draw. They should do this in such a way as to create the highest scoring collections.

The winner is the one who scores the most points and reaches the finish line with his pawn the fastest.


Moc Słowa to gra planszowa, dzięki której można poznać opowieści o Panu Jezusie i spędzić doskonały czas z rodziną lub przyjaciółmi.Do gry wprowadza historia o ludziach, którzy poszukują skarbów. Odnaleźli skrzynię, a w niej fragmenty bezcennych, tkanych obrazów, ukazujących sceny z Ewangelii.
Teraz skarb znajduje się w rękach graczy. Mają przed sobą piękne, wielobarwne karty ze scenami z Ewangelii, a także obrazki i słowa z Biblii. W swojej turze decydują, którą kostką rzucić i które dobrać karty. Powinni to zrobić w taki sposób, by utworzyć najwyżej punktowane kolekcje.

Wygra ten, kto zdobędzie najwięcej punktów i najszybciej dotrze swoim pionkiem do mety.

Gra rozwija spostrzegawczość, myślenie strategiczne i przede wszystkim wiedzę biblijną.
Poznaj Biblię. Odkrywaj Moc Biblijnego Słowa.

boardgame.name: Planet A: Das nachhaltige Kartenspiel
boardgame.description:
Challenge: The earth is our Planet A. It is worth the effort to protect it, because there is no Planet B. Rising CO2 emission and a plastic torrent overwhelm our sensitive ecosystem; climate change and species extinction arise with all consequent changes. Strive against that and save our blue planet. In the process, ecological calamities and forever outdated political parties get in your way. Do not give in. We save the earth step by step - as long as everyone contributes.

Solution: By the use of 105 different cards about sustainability , the players face up with all kinds of environmentally friendly everyday items and ideas. With realistic tasks and practical ideas, the game throws a bridge into the real life and is thought-provoking. Playfully learning with a lot of fun plus making the world a bit better.

Description of the game: All players have to fulfil a secret task: either to collect certain thematic cards in their hand or to help the team Planet A get a collection in the middle of the table. Whoever accomplishes three tasks at first wins. Ecological calamity cards, environmental hero cards and environmental activist cards whirl the game and encourage discussions on sustainability.

—description from the publisher (translated)

boardgame.name: First Holiday Memories
Premiers Souvenirs de Vacances
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

In the 1990s, somewhere deep in the country, you found a treasure. Thirty years later, you're back in the same town and realize the story is not over yet...

First holiday memories is a demo version of Two Summers, a game of sunny adventures and light drama which will be financed from Feb. 1st to Feb. 14th. 2021. It's designed with a GM and 3 to 5 players.

In this version, you'll find a diceless game system which encourages balancing between the characters' personal lives and their adventures, as well as a complete adventure and 6 pre-made characters, enough for at least one session of a few hours!


Dans les années 1990, quelque part dans la cambrousse française, vous avez trouvé un trésor. Trente ans plus tard, vous revenez sur place et découvrez que l'histoire n'est pas tout à fait finie...

Premiers souvenirs de vacances est une version découverte de Deux Étés, un jeu en financement du 1er au 14 février 2021. Elle se joue avec un MJ et de 3 à 5 joueuses.

Vous trouverez dans cette version un système de jeu sans dé favorisant l'équilibre entre la vie personnelle des personnages et leurs aventures, ainsi qu'un scénario complet et 6 prétirés pour une aventure de quelques heures ou plus !

boardgame.name: Deux Étés
Two Summers
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

You know that Stephen King book, with the scary clown? Well imagine that: last summer, I scrammed from the big city with my parents, and I went through a crazy adventure in the boondocks with my pals! We got way scared, we had some fun, I even got a girlfriend for a while... I could’ve made a novel out of it. Would have gotten myself the Booker Prize for sure (though I swear it’s all true!). But I turned it into a roleplaying game instead! And just like in King’s novel, I started to think about how things would be if our adventure weren’t finished and 30 years later, we’d be back there, tying up things! That’s why I’m calling the game 2 Crazy Summers: short and to the point. In a nutshell: we’ll play teens who go adventuring during the summer and the same characters as adults!

TWO SUMMERS is a tabletop RPG for a GM and 3 to 5 players, who take the role of the same characters at two different time periods: as teenagers in the 1990s, living an unforgettable adventure, and as adults 30 years later, coming back to the same place and realizing the adventure is not over. The game is conceived for campaigns of 7-8 sessions, lasting around 3 hours each.

You'll like this game if you enjoy light drama, sunny adventures and good-hearted nostalgia! Its diceless system is deliberately very simple: you can explain it in a few minutes and its summary fits on a single page, so as to better put a greater emphasis on storytelling and roleplaying.

The zine features a complete game system plus everything you need to build your own campaign within its 60 pages:

Instructions to create characters and a relation map through a "session zero"
A thorough guide helping you to create your own TWO SUMMERS campaign, including advice, step by step examples and 25 semi-prepared subplots to insert into your story
Players and GM advice
A character and GM sheet


Tu connais le bouquin de Stephen King avec le clown qui fait peur ? Eh bin imagine : cet été, je me suis barré de la capitale avec mes parents, et dans la cambrousse j’ai vécu une aventure dingue avec les copains et les copines ! On a eu bien peur, on a passé du bon temps, j’ai même eu une petite copine… J’aurais pu en faire un roman, j’suis sûr que j’aurais eu le Goncourt direct, même si j’te jure que tout c’que j’ai vécu c’est vrai. À la place j’en ai fait un jeu de rôle ! Et comme dans le bouquin, j’me suis mis à gamberger sur comment ça serait si notre aventure était pas finie et 30 ans plus tard on revenait sur place finir le truc ! C’est pour ça que j’appelle le jeu 2 Étés de Ouf : simple, efficace. Donc pour résumer, dans le jeu on joue des ados qui partent à l’aventure pendant l’été et les mêmes devenus adultes !

DEUX ÉTÉS est un jeu de rôle pour 1 MJ et 3 à 5 joueurs, dans lequel ces derniers incarnent le même personnage à deux périodes différentes de sa vie : lors de l'été de ses 15 ans, où il va vivre une aventure incroyable, et pendant un été de sa quarantaine, de retour sur les lieux. Le jeu est conçu pour être exploré lors d'une campagne de 7 à 8 séances de 3 heures chacune.

Vous aimerez ce jeu si vous aimez les mélodrames légers, les aventures ensoleillées et la nostalgie faisant chaud au cœur ! Son système sans dés est volontairement très simple, explicable en quelques minutes et résumable en une page, pour laisser la part belle à la narration et l'interprétation des personnages.

Outre un système de jeu complet, vous trouverez dans les 60 pages de ce jeu :

Des instructions pour créer les personnages et une carte des relations pendant une « session zéro »
Un guide complet pour vous aider à créer votre propre campagne de DEUX ÉTÉS, incluant des conseils, un exemple pas à pas et 25 canevas semi-préparés à insérer dans votre intrigue
Des conseils au MJ et aux joueurs
Une feuille de personnage et une fiche de MJ

boardgame.name: Autres Étés
Other Summers
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

In this 80-page supplement for Two Summers, you'll find:

Options to create adventures as a group and/or play without a GM
A darker version to the base game and a one-shot adventure to go with it
Variants to introduce supernatural elements to the base game: magic, parallel universes and time travel options, with a one-shot adventure to go with the latter
Variants to play a short campaign of Two Summers based in the city instead of the country and/or in the winter instead of the summer
Variants to play in other eras, play children and/or old people, or play people from the same family, with a one-shot adventure to go with the latter
A SRD (System Reference Document) of the game to encourage other hacks, variants and options!


Dans les 80 pages de ce supplément pour Deux Étés, vous trouverez :

Des options pour créer des aventures en commun et/ou pour jouer sans MJ
Une version plus sombre du jeu de base et un scénario one-shot l'accompagnant
Des variantes pour introduire des éléments surnaturels au jeu de base : de la magie, des univers parallèles et du voyage dans le temps, avec un scénario one-shot accompagnant cette dernière option
Des variantes pour jouer une courte campagne de Deux Étés se déroulant dans la ville et non la campagne et/ou en hiver au lieu de l'été
Des variantes pour jouer à d'autres époques, jouer des enfants et/ou des personnes âgées, ou jouer des membres d'une même famille à travers le temps, avec un scénario one-shot accompagnant cette dernière option
Un DRS (Document de Référence du Système) du jeu pour encourager d'autres hacks, variantes et options !

boardgame.name: Čiri-biri Bajka
boardgame.description:
A children's storytelling game, where players are presented with a basic narrative arc which informs them of what they need to accomplish. Each player has his own character with which he explores the map by opening new hexagon tiles and finding different items. These serve as inspiration and opportunity to tell a story and progress thorugh the game towards it narrative finale.

On a turn, a player rolls a die which tells him how many action points he gets to use. As an action, he can open a new tile, move to an adjacent tile, or pick up an item from the tile he is on. There's also a possibility he gets to use his special power. All this should be narrated as well. The game ends when all the story cards are completed, that is, a set amount of items in requested colours are collected. The players win together, I noted the game is cooperative. But I guess, there is no winning as such, as the game is about telling a story, there is no mechanical challenge.

boardgame.name: Opposite of Wellness
boardgame.description:
Improve your wellness one opposite at a time.

Contents: 9 Category/Topic cards.

Players will be dealt a card which determines 3 categories as areas of wellness they have to improve.

Each round a topic and two categories will be determined.

Players will answer the question:

What is the [CATEGORY] opposite of [TOPIC]?

Players will reveal their answers in turns. If a player wrote your exact answer, you must pass for the round. Then players must vote for the best answer. Players will win points by voting for the same player, and for being the most voted on a category of their area of wellness. Then they repeat for the opposite category.

When all 8 topics are completed, game ends and the player with the highest score wins.

listing.notes: Never been played. From a smoke-free, pet-free home. I have several small games listed that can be packed together for cheaper shipping.

boardgame.name: The Years Between
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Years Between is an alternate method for quickly leveling characters in a fantasy role-playing campaign. This 20pp supplemental booklet is specifically styled for Dungeon Crawl Classics by Goodman Games. However, with mild adaptation it can be used for any fantasy roleplaying system.

To level by standard means, a PC must survive multiple low-level adventures, but with The Years Between the leveling process is accelerated in order to serve the Judge's needs or make higher level modules achievable. Before each adventure, the Judge should check to see if all PCs have the required levels needed. If not, each PC will move through the steps below to achieve the needed level(s) and create the story of that experience.
boardgame.rpg: Dungeon Crawl Classics Role Playing Game

boardgame.name: The Towers of Dr. Xill
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Dr. Xillgracone (aka Dr. Xill) was a genius and madman who experimented with the natural order of life on himself and others. Using super-science devices infused with the raw power of fire and ice, he summoned and enslaved elemental creatures to merge with his human subjects.

Explore Dr. Xills tower by thawing out the chambers...but beware what you may find!

However, an imbalance of thermal and polar micro-elementals used to control his labs tilted toward the polar side and slowly his menagerie was encased in ice—freezing Dr. Xill’s operations for millennia. Some say he miscalculated, others argue that his mind cracked and he took his own life, while still others insist his final act was precise and calculated—his plan yet to take effect. That is until now . . .

This 20pp 2nd/3rd level adventure is created for Dungeon Crawl Classics or Mutant Crawl Classics by Goodman Games, but could be adapted to any RPG adventure.

The map shows ice thickness in areas where PCs must breach to access rooms, items, or evils!

One of the fantastic aspects in The Towers of Dr. Xill is the environment. The ice not only (temporarily) blocks areas of the map, but also interesting items and potential dangers. The PCs will have to carefully manage resources and tools discovered for excavation. And don't forget, the frictionless floors create opportunity for unexpected sliding and unintentional exploration! Frozen hallways may be used by PCs for clever advantages as well as a hasty doom.

And of course, like many of our adventures there are a number of VISUAL PUZZLES for players to solve—this adventure more than any other. Dr. Xill is testing those who enter, and the reward for success may be unwelcome!

Puzzle rooms and visual handouts abound to captivate and test the PCs!
boardgame.rpg: Dungeon Crawl Classics Role Playing Game
Mutant Crawl Classics Role Playing Game

boardgame.name: Defiant Birthright
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Defiant Birthright brings you four new Origin-exclusive Personal Themes that the Players can choose during Character creation. As a Tormented Angel, you will explore guilt and the road to redemption. With the Beast of Prey Theme, your Daeva will become closer to their primal self, wielding the power of a mythical creature. Playing a Compelled Infernal will mean giving complete power over your Character’s True name to a single person. And as the Attuned Leviathan, you will possess a terrifying level of control over your attuned element.

boardgame.name: Academy Adventures
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Is the magic inside you?

Being a wizard requires a serious education, and only the very best attend Zaubereich Academy, where students progress through three levels of learning and gain valuable life skills that will help their adventuring career now and in the future.

This magic school campaign setting features a detailed four-level campus with accompanying maps, rules for playing student wizards, nine new arcane traditions, two new species, 19 new familiars, 22 new monsters to summon, and over 40 NPCs (including students, faculty, and staff). It also includes a random event generator for life at the academy and a variety of special events, from broom racing to formal dancing, magic sports to magical duels.

If you think you have what it takes, put on your best robes, grab your wand, and don your floppy hat. Academy Adventures await!

boardgame.name: L'écho éthérique Nº 15
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

L'écho éthérique est un supplément périodique pour Lore & Legacy, le jeu de rôle de science-fantasy. Tous les mois, nous vous proposerons en prix libre 12 pages de contenu supplémentaire pour le jeu.

Ce numéro propose une aventure se déroulant dans la ville d’Akri, décrite dans L'écho éthérique n°14. Les Francs-Lanciers tenteront d'y élucider une série de disparitions mystérieuses. Une enquête périlleuse qui les conduira jusqu'aux tréfonds de la cité...

boardgame.name: Communion
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The survivors are welcomed with open arms to The Sanctuary, a make-shift commune erected around an old country church. But they soon learn things are not as simple as they seem… and salvation comes at a steep price.

Communion is the second episode of The Living Dead Campaign. This non-traditional Savage Worlds Plot Point Campaign for Dead End takes your Novice survivor characters through the first year of the zombie apocalypse with a recurring series of monthly episodes that tell the gripping tale of fear and survival in a world claimed by the dead.

boardgame.name: A Gift Brought More Precious
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A young couple hires the adventurers to get them home in time for their local holiday, ahead of the brutal winter storms. But the turbulent environment outside the vehicle is nothing compared to the emotional turmoil and arguing within. The couple’s anxiety spills over into bickering and arguments to the point their marriage and even lives are in jeopardy. Can the PCs contend with problems that can’t be solved by the simple pulling of a trigger?

A Gift Brought More Precious is a short adventure for 2D6 science fiction RPGs such as Cepheus Engine and the Original Science Fiction Roleplaying Game.

boardgame.name: The Many Lost Loves of Blackstone Tower
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

An OSR adventure for characters of about fourth level, Blackstone Tower explores what happens to love tainted by power.

Blackstone Tower was supposed to be the perfect home for Virvul and Gosian, two of the greatest wizards in the world. Instead, it was abandoned, their monument to magic. This is the story of that place, and the many loves who came here, and some of those who never left.

Our newest release is an OSR adventure set on a remote island where stands a strange and wondrous wizard's tower. Forged from the strands of the weave of magic and the forces of elemental nature itself, the tower has seen its share of tragedy.

What will your party discover as they explore this watery abode of mages?

(PS. There's also a dragon turtle.)

boardgame.name: Broken Shield 2.0 Roleplaying Game Deluxe Edition Core Book
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

“Superhumans, Living Gods, Coppers & Agents in a Dangerous Future London”

This full-colour, 364-page Deluxe Edition of the Broken Shield Roleplaying Game is a complete game and includes everything you need to play! Enjoy exciting, fast-paced investigation and spy missions in a science-fiction future where Echoes wield reality-warping powers, and living gods meddle in the affairs of humanity... You are the heroes who can bring hope to a fractured universe!

The Broken Shield Roleplaying game is your gateway to an exciting new world of adventure! Inside this book:

Issue #1 of WeaveNet Now! An in-universe magazine full of story hooks and background in a fun format.
The HexDNA system: A complete game system that emphasises fast-paced, “success with complications” action. Build your character your way. Play an Echo: superhumans whose power is only limited by how fast they want to burn up their life, or play a Sliver: genetically and technologically engineered to be faster, stronger and deadlier! Play a passionate Pure, a tough Hulk, a genetailored Gethan or a regular human!
Insider’s Guide to the Steel Alliance: A once-mighty interstellar empire founded by twelve living gods known as the Disciples, now fractured into a handful of feuding successor states on the brink of another civil war. But in the darkness, there is a beacon of hope: The Accord.
Insider’s Guide to the London Metropolice: A complete guide to the London’s crime fighters, how to investigate crimes, copper slang and the law!
Insider’s Guide to The Agency: Cloak and dagger espionage and subterfuge for a spies campaign. How to plan and carry out an operation, bring stability to an unstable universe, threats to the Accord and more!
Insider’s Guide to London & Soho: The starting setting for Broken Shield, the London & Soho Guide presents a fully-fleshed out mega city complete with maps, locations, people, mission hooks and a detailed focus on the borough of Soho & Victory - a perfect setting for your adventures

boardgame.name: Europa Tour
boardgame.description:
In Europa Tour, each player starts in Amsterdam and tries to complete their trip; East, West, South or North, through Europe as quick as possible. The aim of the game is to make his journey through Europe as quickly as possible by adding the city cards of your route in the correct sequence to your route. Each route visits 16 European cities and requires 8 Visa cards at certain specific points of the route for border crossings. You win the game by being the first player to finish your route and end up back in Amsterdam.

The game starts with every player in Amsterdam, the other 96 cards of all four routes (16 city cards and 8 visa cards per route) are then shuffled and put into a grid formation on the table.

During their turn, a player flips 2 cards of their choice and if they fit, extend their trip by adding the cards to their line.

If one or both of the cards are part of your trip but not adjacent to the city you are in, you can safe the card(s) by switching it/them with another one (logically with a card in the grid close to you). At the end of your turn, you flip back all cards.

Some advancements of the routes require visa cards which need to be placed before you are able to advance, and the visa cards are shared between North & East and shared between South & West. Visa cards cannot be saved. The end point of Amsterdam can also not be saved.

This game can be summarized as a game of memory, where you can safe cards for later use and where their is a small competition for visa cards between players (South&West and North&East).
